commit_message:
Parse JSON Schema Draft 10 in v2 Image update

* Add new content type to PATCH /v2/images/<id> to represent support of
  JSON Schema Draft 10: application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch
* Remain backwards-compatibile with existing content type
  that supports Draft 4: application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch
* Fixes bug 1102476

Change-Id: Iff4e8753a71457ad5a828553fcb0791b0f1c0445

commit_message:
Accept 201 status code on POST

On POST requests, keystone should return '201 Created' according to
api docs.

Related to but not dependent on:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1131119

Change-Id: I04c398ad7946f5ddcfd2059e4f8d97608e5d0ed3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 19:09:27.000000000', 'message': "Use min_ram of original image for snapshot, even with VHD

When snapshotting an instance there seems to be no reason that min_ram
can't be set based off of the original image in all cases.  This relaxes
the restriction that VHD backed instances set min_ram for snapshots
based on the current instance.

Bug 1133524

Change-Id: I3779c48d7325f3f0bde496f43a70017fe79d2835
"}]
commit_message:
Use min_ram of original image for snapshot, even with VHD

When snapshotting an instance there seems to be no reason that min_ram
can't be set based off of the original image in all cases.  This relaxes
the restriction that VHD backed instances set min_ram for snapshots
based on the current instance.

Bug 1133524

Change-Id: I3779c48d7325f3f0bde496f43a70017fe79d2835

commit_message:
Fix how tests were failing due to missing attributes.

Fixes: bug #1131845

For unknown reasons all tests continued to pass even after
this change was introduced, besides that being a very odd thing
to have happen it is better to fix said attributes for those
that are running the tests individually in there own CI pipelines.

Change-Id: Iee6acc1d4a528afb840459ca47d754ec7bae8f32

So, where are the answers to my questions?'}, {'account_id': 6888, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:57:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

I checked the other changes on older versions.

1.  os.makedirs(cache_dir, 0o755) does not work on python2.5, but does
on python2.6.
2. The 'as e' does not work on 2.5, but does on 2.6.
3. And the from __future__ import print_function does not work on 2.5.

So the submitted changes works on 2.6, but if the intention is to
support 2.5 than a different solution will be required.

For example, this the suggested solution to support the 'as e':
    http://docs.pythonsprints.com/python3_porting/py-porting.html#handling-exceptions"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-20 22:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2013-03-01 12:25:14.000000000', 'message': 'add quantum_available flag to tempest

this ensures that if we setup quantum, we are explicit about it
in tempest. This is important so that nova tests which require
quantum features have any idea if they should function.

Change-Id: I5e6be9ff325676f25b2c391430dd66ff64a7a833
'}]
commit_message:
add quantum_available flag to tempest

this ensures that if we setup quantum, we are explicit about it
in tempest. This is important so that nova tests which require
quantum features have any idea if they should function.

Change-Id: I5e6be9ff325676f25b2c391430dd66ff64a7a833

commit_message:
Added limit to image-list in a preparatory step toward addressing bug 1001345.

Currently novaclient doesn't use the limit or marker params.
As a step to addressing bug 1001345 which requires pagination,
this patch introduces the use of limit as an option
passed to the image-list function.

Change-Id: Ia32f9e923b4eb9bcdde3b7bc1722c59d7791d104

"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-28 21:29:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMHO, this is the wrong place to solve this. I think this should be nova-api-level validation of things like integral ids. Taking a string for something that should be an int and covering it up with a simple "not found" is throwing away too much information, I'd say.

That said, are we actually taking a database ID from the API? If so, I definitely think it should be sanity-checked way (way) above the db layer.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-28 21:50:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

we do already sanity check above the db API, see https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L1308

However, extremely long int like values can still get through. Given that the details on exactly how long of an int we support isn't totally clear, it seems ok to handle the edge case here."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

My complaint stands that we're raising a NotFound error deep in the database API for something that isn't a NotFound (confusing the case with the legitimate NotFound condition that function can already raise). IMHO, the interpretation of "this integer is larger than the databse can handle for this column" differs at the db/compute layer (where it is a serious error) and the user-facing API layer (where it is a validation question). Raising a NotFound that deep for that odd of a reason just so that it bubbles up to nova-api as the right thing is the Wrong Solution, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:26:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I believe this is an implementation detail below the api. If we implement the API with a different back end the reason why an id is not found is not really interesting, just that it isn't. Leaking that info up from SQLalchemy layer at all seems like bad form.

The id returns no valid instance. The reasons why, in this case that it was impossible that it ever could if it was run on pgsql (though it won't generate the error on mysql), is implementation specific based on the back end, so exposing those implementation details up seems wrong."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think this is fine: logic as follows:
 - if this was a mutating operation, the dataerror would be semantic, it would be saying 'we cannot store this', and the caller needs to know.

 - but this is a lookup. *any* mismatch on the lookup is a NotFound, regardless of the reason [ vs e.g. a DB server being inaccessible which would be different ]."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:54:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I share dansmith's unease about swallowing the DataError.  But it's a subtle point and a multi-person IRC discussion didn't really resolve it, so tie goes to whoever's writing the code, so I'm +0."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-28 23:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-28 23:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 20:04:32.000000000', 'message': "don't stack trace if long ints are passed to db

If we pass something that looks like an int to any of the rest
API calls, but it exceeds the storage size for instance id in the
database, SQLalchemy throws a DataError, and the user sees a 500
instead of InstanceNotFound. This can be triggered by using a
value like 9223372036854775808 for the id.

Instead, catch DataError exception and return the expected not
found.

This was caught when reenabling tempest tests for bug #1046870
and is one of serveral patches in nova needed to enable
test_servers_negative.py in tempest.

Change-Id: I6130863a95567eabd3ae05a09e4a9f26bb5f5098
"}, {'created': '2013-02-28 22:14:15.000000000', 'message': "don't stack trace if long ints are passed to db

If we pass a integer, which is longer than the id field in the
database, but a valid python integer into any of the REST API
calls SQLalchemy throws a DataError, and the user sees a 500
instead of InstanceNotFound. This can be triggered by using a
id of 9223372036854775808 (for instance).

Instead, catch the DataError exception and return the expected
not found.

This was caught when reenabling tempest tests for bug #1046870
and is one of serveral patches in nova needed to enable
test_servers_negative.py in tempest.

Change-Id: I6130863a95567eabd3ae05a09e4a9f26bb5f5098
"}, {'created': '2013-02-28 22:57:46.000000000', 'message': "don't stack trace if long ints are passed to db

If we pass a integer, which is longer than the id field in the
database, but a valid python integer into any of the REST API
calls SQLalchemy throws a DataError, and the user sees a 500
instead of InstanceNotFound. This can be triggered by using a
id of 9223372036854775808 (for instance).

This issue is seen on postgresql, mysql and sqlite don't hit it.

Instead, catch the DataError exception, and return an InvalidID
exception. If InvalidID is thrown catch that at the API layer
and return the expected not found.

This was caught when reenabling tempest tests for bug #1046870
and is one of serveral patches in nova needed to enable
test_servers_negative.py in tempest.

commit_message:
don't stack trace if long ints are passed to db

If we pass a integer, which is longer than the id field in the
database, but a valid python integer into any of the REST API
calls SQLalchemy throws a DataError, and the user sees a 500
instead of InstanceNotFound. This can be triggered by using a
id of 9223372036854775808 (for instance).

This issue is seen on postgresql, mysql and sqlite don't hit it.

Instead, catch the DataError exception, and return an InvalidID
exception. If InvalidID is thrown catch that at the API layer
and return the expected not found.

This was caught when reenabling tempest tests for bug #1046870
and is one of serveral patches in nova needed to enable
test_servers_negative.py in tempest.

Change-Id: I6130863a95567eabd3ae05a09e4a9f26bb5f5098

subject: Make auth token middleware use nova's memorycache
messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-01 00:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Throwing this out there for feedback. I noticed that devstack wastes a lot of time validating tokens since it doesn't deploy with memcached. There is really no reason why the middleware shouldn't fallback to an in memory cache, so I've modified the default pipeline to stick the one from nova in. I had to make a slight modification since it is expecting the keystone api."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-01 01:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-01 01:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

How beautiful, such a small modification and a whole layer of memcache support introduced. Good work!'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-01 02:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This is up here for feedback. I think it would be much cleaner to simply use the memorycache in the middleware. Perhaps we could copy it in now and move it to openstack common in h?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-03-01 22:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make auth token middleware use nova's memorycache

The memcached options in the keystone middleware don't have a fallback
to an in-memory cache, so modify the paste config to pass in nova's
version, which supports the fallback.

Change-Id: I8bc3790d3b0b35ea0309b73521403669d22343c2

commit_message:
Fallback to in-memory cache if no memcached.

Verifying tokens accounts for a significant portion of the time taken
by the various api servers. This copies the simple memory cache over
from nova so that there is a simple default cache even if memcached
is not deployed.

Change-Id: Iad2c12ef8e0e8c23461008452b9345ce219b2b29

(2 inline comments)

We need fraction of second precision to prevent PKI token ID overlap."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:40:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Disregarding the issue of 'issued_at' being a hack incapable of actually avoiding collisions, does openstack.common.timeutils actually provide a method for producing ISO 8601 compliant datetime strings with microsecond precision? I don't see one. PERFECT_TIME_FORMAT, which is utilized by timeutils.strtime() and timeutils.parse_strtime(), is close but missing the timezone (Z)."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Revised ISO 8601 references

Resolved the FIXME's by doing a little research into how ISO 8601
formats are defined.

Also revised all the expires_at and issued_at examples to reference
http://xkcd.com/1179/ which has the handy property of making it clear
which segment is the month, day, hour, and minute.

Change-Id: I81eaf020d2735748a77989fcf494876bd73d814f

commit_message:
Add simple in-memory cache from nova.

Nova's simple in-memory cache replicates the memcache interface,
so clients can cache things in memcache or in memory using
the same commands. Using memcached requires having the client
library installed and the memcached_servers config option set.
Callers can also pass in a list of memcached servers when they
initialize the client.

Change-Id: I831142a36797b04006cba4792df803e09f6fd69b

commit_message:
Fixed formpost QUERY_STRING bugs.

Ensures that any QUERY_STRING to FormPost is not passed onward.
Handles a redirect with a query string properly.

Change-Id: If0a7d9b0a17314c6cd3852175362d4633f828d81

Ok, last set of comments from me, sorry for the slow reviewing ... +2 after this.

In general this seems fine to merge with a FFE to me.  The risk is very low.  It only affects impl_zmq.  Further, this code isn't used by default in impl_zmq.

My most significant concern is the overlap with the service registry in nova (the services table in the db and the servicegroup API).  I don't think we need to hold this up because of that, but it's something worth looking into improving in the future."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-02-28 15:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

Russell, you have a point about the ServiceGroupAPI. It so happens the MatchMaker actually came first, but at the time we did not have database code in oslo-incubator. I also have a patch for the ServiceGroupAPI for it to rely on the MatchMaker, but for various reasons I've delayed that work until Havana.

I'll look at those docstrings.."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Works for me

Dava: TestCase is a bit magical, so there might have been a valid technical reason for it besides caution.  However, I honestly don't remember why I did it that way."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-28 22:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

If the methods are optional, I think it should just be 'pass' instead of logging a warning.  As it is now, impl_zmq will always call (at least some of) these methods, resulting in warnings in the logs."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-01 08:33:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:31:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

Better handling the non-existence of a redis dependency and added a unit test.

Mark, good catch on the fact that send_heartbeats() was wrong in the parent class. The unit tests passed because the Redis class overrode that method. I removed the one in the redis class and fixed the one in the parent.

I've also changed ack_alive() and send_heartbeats() a bit to clarify the behavior, which was redis-specific behavior. The failure of an ack_alive causing a re-register is now in ack_alive itself, as part of the redis implementation of that method."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:41:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: (1 inline comment)

I'm a bit concerned about using reload() in a test.  It's got a lot of edge cases, and I'm afraid it might work now and mysteriously break later.  If you can't think of a better way to test the import then I'm okay with it, but we might want to add a comment."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Redis-based matchmaker

Introduces a reference implementation
of a matchmaker (based on redis) that
supports dynamic host/topic registrations,
host expiration, and hooks for consuming
applications to acknowledge or neg-acknowledge
topic.host service availability.

Implements blueprint advanced-matchmaking

Change-Id: I8608d2089fca118b0e369f2eb5c6aedacf6821fe

[{'created': '2013-03-01 21:02:36.000000000', 'message': "remove the namespace_packages from setup.py

In reddwarf's setup.py, the method setuptool.setup() currently accepts a parameter for namespace_packages, and it shouldn't.

Change-Id: Ica1fbebd5cbd5943c3a1b322d14a280737bc0542
fixes: bug #1136189
"}]
commit_message:
remove the namespace_packages from setup.py

In reddwarf's setup.py, the method setuptool.setup() currently accepts a parameter for namespace_packages, and it shouldn't.

Change-Id: Ica1fbebd5cbd5943c3a1b322d14a280737bc0542

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Thanks Alex.

I have very few comments inline for this code which looks very good.
The only concern I have is not related to your code, but to the fact that so far pagination and sorting are not exposed by any CLI for Openstack projects.

I'm not opposed to it, but perhaps we should strive to keep CLIs as uniform as possible in order to avoid confusion in users.
I will leave to the CLI team leader, Yong, the decision on this."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Salvatore, thanks for your review!

Glance CLI expose '--page-size' option as pagination support. If we didn't have this option, when server have an max limit, then user can't get all items by CLI.

For sorting, you are right, I didn't found that expose by other project."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add pagination support for client

Fixes bug 1130625

Add pagination params: -P, --page-size SIZE
Add sorting params: --sort-key FIELD --sort-dir {asc,desc}
Add xml support

Change-Id: I76abb6335f53176feade216413a8cabaaefe42be

commit_message:
Update references of "folsom" to "grizzly"

The instructions as provided in the page at <http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/apt/content/osfolubuntu-prerquisite.html> should pretty much work the same for grizzly as they do for folsom, assuming that you change the specific names of the repositories that you're using to suit.

Change-Id: I22aca91c0a9aa396117709c347f106aede387013

[{'created': '2013-03-01 00:04:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "gatewaty" typo in /etc/network/interfaces

The example /etc/network/interfaces file from the page at <http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/apt/content/osfolubuntu-prerquisite.html> has a trivial typo in it that says "gatewaty10.211.55.1" when it should say "gateway 10.211.55.1".

Change-Id: I471a30fce99e6051f862f648150089cf4058fd0f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "gatewaty" typo in /etc/network/interfaces

The example /etc/network/interfaces file from the page at <http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/apt/content/osfolubuntu-prerquisite.html> has a trivial typo in it that says "gatewaty10.211.55.1" when it should say "gateway 10.211.55.1".

Change-Id: I471a30fce99e6051f862f648150089cf4058fd0f

commit_message:
chown /opt/stack/data to the stack user

The stack user needs to be able to read and write files in the
data directory during tests.  Previously it worked because permissions
were wide open.  But bug #1129748 requires making images less visible
to avoid leaking private information, and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22278/ to fix that bug fails tests
because, after reducing permissions, the stack user can no longer
see the data files while running tests.

Refs bug #1129748.

Change-Id: I764ef1e66a4b164638c3e64eac30b5f488e23038

commit_message:
update.py: DRY up using functools.partial()

We call _copy_pyfile() a bunch of times with the same base and
dest_dir arguments. Clean that up using functools.partial().

Change-Id: I22a3e748f2e138b17a6b99d90ec9eca72698f6e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-01 14:25:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix flaky unit test

This was failing intermittently during the gate tests because there was no
dependency in the template for the Instance on the WaitConditionHandle, nor
for the WaitCondition on the Instance, so the order in which resources
would be created was somewhat random.

This patch fixes the test template, and tests updating the metadata should
occur *during* creation of the stack, as well after, to replicate a real
wait condition (which won't finish creation until the metadata update
occurs).

Change-Id: I26b5590a9ee90d205bd9f2e31bcb74e68065ac25
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix flaky unit test

This was failing intermittently during the gate tests because there was no
dependency in the template for the Instance on the WaitConditionHandle, nor
for the WaitCondition on the Instance, so the order in which resources
would be created was somewhat random.

This patch fixes the test template, and tests updating the metadata should
occur *during* creation of the stack, as well after, to replicate a real
wait condition (which won't finish creation until the metadata update
occurs).

Change-Id: I26b5590a9ee90d205bd9f2e31bcb74e68065ac25
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update defaults for s3 materials paths/names

devstack has upgraded to downloading the cirros-0.3.1 image.
This change updates the ari/ami/aki manifest defaults in
tempest.conf.sample to match as otherwise the relevant tests
are fairly quietly skipped.

Adds a configuration option to set the timeout for waiting on
remote ssh commands to finish. This is necessary as the
test_integration_1 now executes with this fix and times out
on the CI systems due to the ssh command taking longer than
the hardcoded timeout.

Change-Id: I744d242416ed63ab49facae70948d5c007df13c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 20:39:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix endpoint usage for glance_http in image client.

Previously the image client was using python-keystoneclient to
generate a new token and to get the endpoint for glance to use
with the glance http library. This was causing permission issues
if the rest client was used to try and delete an image created using
glance_http.

This commit corrects the behavior so that the token and endpoint are
acquired the same way as the rest client so there is no potential
permission issues between the http libraries.

Change-Id: Idff5fcb82019c6b807b87dda480fbcf0b6f8aef2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix endpoint usage for glance_http in image client.

Previously the image client was using python-keystoneclient to
generate a new token and to get the endpoint for glance to use
with the glance http library. This was causing permission issues
if the rest client was used to try and delete an image created using
glance_http.

This commit corrects the behavior so that the token and endpoint are
acquired the same way as the rest client so there is no potential
permission issues between the http libraries.

Change-Id: Idff5fcb82019c6b807b87dda480fbcf0b6f8aef2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 13:13:19.000000000', 'message': "Add a 'hw_' namespace to glance hardware config properties

This updates the libvirt driver to use a 'hw_' prefix on
the names of hardware config properties it looks up for
glance images. Thus the new syntax for setting custom
hardware properties is

      # glance image-update \
               --property hw_disk_bus=ide \
               --property hw_cdrom_bus=ide \
               --property hw_vif_model=e1000 \
               f16-x86_64-openstack-sda

There is no back-compat support for the previous 'disk_bus',
'cdrom_bus' and 'vif_model' names, since they were never
made available in any formal release, only development
snapshots.

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-custom-hardware
Fixes bug 1132739
Change-Id: Ic15ef0eba065113b35bbb2713be2532c858c3534
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add a 'hw_' namespace to glance hardware config properties

This updates the libvirt driver to use a 'hw_' prefix on
the names of hardware config properties it looks up for
glance images. Thus the new syntax for setting custom
hardware properties is

      # glance image-update \
               --property hw_disk_bus=ide \
               --property hw_cdrom_bus=ide \
               --property hw_vif_model=e1000 \
               f16-x86_64-openstack-sda

There is no back-compat support for the previous 'disk_bus',
'cdrom_bus' and 'vif_model' names, since they were never
made available in any formal release, only development
snapshots.

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-custom-hardware
Fixes bug 1132739
Change-Id: Ic15ef0eba065113b35bbb2713be2532c858c3534
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow heat to be used without a KeyName set.

This patch lets you start an instance without setting the KeyName, which
I gather is allowed in ec2 as well.

This revision adds a template and test.

Fixes: bug #1129394
Change-Id: I667f373b73479caa506ee49d8d1615ff4aad47ed
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

a kwarg, although __init__.py expects this
to be a standard argument.

Tests are not yet covering this, but
are forthcoming.

Change-Id: Id6a0a81ef250e43c7ab3dc9d5392f89752d0f313
'}]
commit_message:
Zmq correct envelope param for notify()

The notify parameter was expected as
a kwarg, although __init__.py expects this
to be a standard argument.

Tests are not yet covering this, but
are forthcoming.

Change-Id: Id6a0a81ef250e43c7ab3dc9d5392f89752d0f313

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 18:30:05.000000000', 'message': 'Zmq notifier topic manip fix.

The ZeroMQ driver needs to manipulate
the topic for notifications because
the period is used as a delimiter internally.

The code was already trying to perform
this modification via topic.replace,
but was not storing the result.

Change-Id: I02a174dd96ff9181f6d7460fd41434ea05fb39d4
'}]
commit_message:
Zmq notifier topic manip fix.

The ZeroMQ driver needs to manipulate
the topic for notifications because
the period is used as a delimiter internally.

The code was already trying to perform
this modification via topic.replace,
but was not storing the result.

Change-Id: I02a174dd96ff9181f6d7460fd41434ea05fb39d4

commit_message:
Ensure "Add Interface" form in Admin Panel works

This commit add new templates for interface add/delete operations
in admin panel to make sure the original page is displayed after
adding a router interface successfully.

It also changes the following:
- Update the help message in "Add Interface" and "Set Gateway" forms
  (both in project and admin panels)
- Fixes a issue that Project router detail was displayed after setting
  an external gateway to a router in admin panel.
  Admin router detail is expected to display
- Make sure a router name is displayed in router detail in admin panel.

Fixes Bug #1131177

Change-Id: I9728cb68972977f868549b61979d9c779cd9fd4e

commit_message:
Only use iscsi_helper config option if using LVMISCSIDriver

_get_iscsi_properties checks for iscsi_helper == 'tgtadm',
but this is run for drivers other than LVMISCSIDriver.

Only change target_lun based on iscsi_helper if using
LVMISCSIDriver/ThinLVMVolumeDriver.

Change-Id: I8c63f8d4097682c875bbfdfade665fdacbcf8e22

Implement generic iSCSI backup and restore functions in the iSCSI
driver providing a default backup/restore for all iSCSI drivers.

populated by xen.

provider_auth and availability_zone are also needed to make the

Change-Id: I124eb5487af8409ca3c3a56627318e09925fbe3d

commit_message:
Snapshots provider_location field inconsistently used

Snapshots have a provider_location field that is currently only
populated by xen.

provider_auth and availability_zone are also needed to make the
snapshot useful after the parent volume has been deleted.

This patch adds the new fields, and ensures all three get filled
in to a snapshot by default. The driver is free to modify the
pre-copied fields in its model update as before.

Change-Id: I124eb5487af8409ca3c3a56627318e09925fbe3d

commit_message:
Prototype support for better block device mapping

This is basically the design outlined in
http://wiki.openstack.org/BlockDeviceConfig but it's not all
implemented yet, and there are no tests. This is just convenient for
testing the api.

Change-Id: Iadf9d214ec44df93bdeba84d8e8061cc66b4dc93
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 22:11:04.000000000', 'message': "Add conversion between local and volume storage on boot

Cinder has the ability to convert from images to volumes, from volumes
to images, and snapshots to volumes. These are all useful ways to
create a new vm with the desired software.

Add source_type, dest_type, and image_id to the database (it already
has snapshot_id and volume_id for the existing block_device_mapping
handling). Use these existing fields to make backwards compatibility
at the virt driver level simpler.

source_type may be 'image', 'volume', 'snapshot', or 'blank'.
dest_type may be 'local' or 'volume'.

When the dest_type is different from the source_type and involves
volumes, use the cinder api to create a new image to use as the basis
for a local disk, or a new volume.

Wait for this to complete until the instance build timeout is reached,
or the image/volume being created enters a state that we cannot use it
in.

Note that this also enables using more than virtual disk created
from an image, even if they are all local. This could be restricted
to only one local disk based on an image so that there is less chance
of creating bugs with this new behavior.

This is based on ndipanov's prototype of a block_device_mapping_v2
addition to the api. It fixes a few typos in there temporarily,
and renames uuid to id in the api payload.

Handling of default device names is not addressed here, as other
patches already in progress do this. Once these land, I expect this
will need a bit of refactoring.

Still to come:
* unit tests
* handling size appropriately with the given instance_type
* better validation in the api

DocImpact
Blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume
Blueprint: flexible-block-device-handling
Change-Id: Ida0b6cdcd14c43abe2ddabd169e53743bc28bc34
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add conversion between local and volume storage on boot

Cinder has the ability to convert from images to volumes, from volumes
to images, and snapshots to volumes. These are all useful ways to
create a new vm with the desired software.

Add source_type, dest_type, and image_id to the database (it already
has snapshot_id and volume_id for the existing block_device_mapping
handling). Use these existing fields to make backwards compatibility
at the virt driver level simpler.

source_type may be 'image', 'volume', 'snapshot', or 'blank'.
dest_type may be 'local' or 'volume'.

When the dest_type is different from the source_type and involves
volumes, use the cinder api to create a new image to use as the basis
for a local disk, or a new volume.

Wait for this to complete until the instance build timeout is reached,
or the image/volume being created enters a state that we cannot use it
in.

Note that this also enables using more than virtual disk created
from an image, even if they are all local. This could be restricted
to only one local disk based on an image so that there is less chance
of creating bugs with this new behavior.

This is based on ndipanov's prototype of a block_device_mapping_v2
addition to the api. It fixes a few typos in there temporarily,
and renames uuid to id in the api payload.

Handling of default device names is not addressed here, as other
patches already in progress do this. Once these land, I expect this
will need a bit of refactoring.

Still to come:
* unit tests
* handling size appropriately with the given instance_type
* better validation in the api

DocImpact
Blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume
Blueprint: flexible-block-device-handling
Change-Id: Ida0b6cdcd14c43abe2ddabd169e53743bc28bc34
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

commit_message:
Fixes a Hyper-V live migration issue

Fixes Bug: 1129091

Adds return values to check_can_live_migrate_destination
and check_can_live_migrate_source and some debug log notifications.

Removes the deprecated compare_cpu method.

The base class documentation currently does not specify any return
value constraint for the aforementioned methods so the return type
has been inferred from nova/compute/manager.py.

Change-Id: Ic4b09be4f3958f6d22a9ee41bc8037d2c2e95c0b

[{'created': '2013-02-28 19:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Elevate context for delete volume with no host.

So in the case of a volume that is placed in error state
on create and never actually deployed, the cinder.volume.api delete
call does a short cut call to db.destroy_volume which is fine because
all we have is a DB entry (scheduler never deployed the volume).

Unfortunately, this requires admin context, so just add an elevate
context to the db.destroy_volume call.

Fixes bug: 1084273

Change-Id: I0ef8bf4356047c385bef703b8dce7d5edf537bf6
'}]
commit_message:
Elevate context for delete volume with no host.

So in the case of a volume that is placed in error state
on create and never actually deployed, the cinder.volume.api delete
call does a short cut call to db.destroy_volume which is fine because
all we have is a DB entry (scheduler never deployed the volume).

Unfortunately, this requires admin context, so just add an elevate
context to the db.destroy_volume call.

Fixes bug: 1084273

Change-Id: I0ef8bf4356047c385bef703b8dce7d5edf537bf6

Modified swift backup service to catch socket errors when talking to
swift and raise a specific SwiftConnectionFailed exception in these
cases. This allows us to provide a more readable error message
detailing the problem connecting to swift to the end user when they
view the backup. Also reduced the default number of swift retries
and backups so devstack environments fail faster - production
environments can tune these in cinder.conf.

Fixes bug: 1132791

Change-Id: Ibca744ea5adcbd31d068ac3d858bde6a4a0c9844

commit_message:
Improved fail_reason for cinder-backup swift connection errors

Modified swift backup service to catch socket errors when talking to
swift and raise a specific SwiftConnectionFailed exception in these
cases. This allows us to provide a more readable error message
detailing the problem connecting to swift to the end user when they
view the backup. Also reduced the default number of swift retries
so devstack environments fail faster - production environments can
tune these in cinder.conf.

Fixes bug: 1132791

Change-Id: Ibca744ea5adcbd31d068ac3d858bde6a4a0c9844

commit_message:
Do a metadata refresh after an explicit metadata write.

if we have a template with (logically) the following:
instance2:
   metadata
     GetAtt waitcond.data

waitcond:

when the waitcond is fired, it updates the metadata but it needs a call
to update the references in "instance2's" metadata.

bug #1135229
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1a6af9112ba100b17075063f59165b448d6a11f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 22:55:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix response code for successful image upload.

The API spec specifies the response code for a successful image
upload is supposed to be 204. However, currently the response is
201. This commit fixes this, and sets the response code to 204.

Fixes bug 1136480

Change-Id: I7ea3926c2dd86961f2dd9bc975b10799560ef20a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix response code for successful image upload.

The API spec specifies the response code for a successful image
upload is supposed to be 204. However, currently the response is
201. This commit fixes this, and sets the response code to 204.

Fixes bug 1136480

Change-Id: I7ea3926c2dd86961f2dd9bc975b10799560ef20a

commit_message:
NetApp: Clean up lock file left behind by unit tests

The synchronization decorator added to the NetAppISCSIDriver class
creates a lock file named cinder/openstack/cinder-netapp_dfm
during the unit tests. This commit cleans it up.

Fixes bug 1135619

Change-Id: Iec41a0f23d4a1c6668bdcb451c2c02efd3f97500

commit_message:
Add the format existence check for "image-create"

If "glance image-create" without --container-format and --disk-format,
glance server must return an error and an incomplete metadata remains
in glance server.
So this patch adds the existence check for --container-format and
--disk-format options.

Fixes bug 1095081

Change-Id: I7199f2ce6d7c9046d369f50979d0b40ffc35db7c

commit_message:
fix xml clients for negative tests

the xml clients were failing additional tests because the clients
didn't support all the features as the json tests. This enables
security_groups and networks in the xml client for create.

It also skips the test_create_numeric_server_name as that can't be
tested in xml, it always turns it into a string.

Change-Id: Ia74aaddc76feeaeaaa51b4ae7835f8ceca43ccff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 21:48:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix crash in quantumapi if no network or port id is specified

The existing code assumes that if no port id or fixed ip was specified,
that the network id passed in is valid. This is not necessarily the case,
and results in adding None to the list of network ids, which later
causes a check to see if the network id list is empty to fail.

This only adds the network id to the list if it was specified, and
adds a more explicit check to the region that previously fell through
without finding a matching network so that a similar case would be
easier to debug in the future.

Addresses bug #1131264

Change-Id: I7a8aaea5772707b8bd6313249e74b1302eedefe8
'}, {'created': '2013-02-26 14:58:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix crash in quantumapi if no network or port id is specified

The existing code assumes that if no port id or fixed ip was specified,
that the network id passed in is valid. This is not necessarily the case,
and results in adding None to the list of network ids, which later
causes a check to see if the network id list is empty to fail.

This only adds the network id to the list if it was specified, and
adds a more explicit check to the region that previously fell through
without finding a matching network so that a similar case would be
easier to debug in the future.

Addresses bug #1131264

Change-Id: I7a8aaea5772707b8bd6313249e74b1302eedefe8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crash in quantumapi if no network or port id is specified

The existing code assumes that if no port id or fixed ip was specified,
that the network id passed in is valid. This is not necessarily the case,
and results in adding None to the list of network ids, which later
causes a check to see if the network id list is empty to fail.

This only adds the network id to the list if it was specified, and
adds a more explicit check to the region that previously fell through
without finding a matching network so that a similar case would be
easier to debug in the future.

Addresses bug #1131264

Change-Id: I7a8aaea5772707b8bd6313249e74b1302eedefe8

subject: make swift fsync
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/1614 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-swift-docs/1465 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-swift-python26/1711 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-swift-python27/1715 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/5479 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/10163 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/5198 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:36:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I like Linux as much as the next guy, but wasn't that wacky FsyncWrapper thing added to support other OSes?  Would this patch would regress that?"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-27 09:21:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It still does the wacky F_FULLSYNC thing instead of fsync on OSX.

It's kind of weird that someone was so concerned about durability on OSX that they refused to use its fsync, which is mostly okay, but they were perfectly fine with linux only ever doing fdatasync.

Also, that wrapper class is pretty ugly."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-27 15:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, I see... I got f(data)sync confused with fallocate, which has Solaris compat stuff.

I guess it was Brian Cline @ Softlayer who added compatibility for BSD platforms (not specifically OS X).  I'll ping him and see if he can give this a sanity-check on their platform."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 22:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-27 23:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay, I can kill that.  I assumed it was for fcntl, since fsync and fdatasync raise an OSError if they fail.

http://svn.python.org/view/python/branches/release27-maint/Modules/posixmodule.c?view=markup#l699'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 23:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think it's copy-paste code from fallocate(), which calls functions that get pulled out of libc with ctypes. The ctypes stuff in fsync() was introduced in f91198d, but I don't think it did anything even then."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 01:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 01:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 01:43:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Actually, if the underlying fcntl fails, Python raises an IOError() instead of returning -1.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/fcntl.html#fcntl.fcntl
http://svn.python.org/view/python/branches/release27-maint/Modules/fcntlmodule.c?view=markup#l72

I'm now catching and re-raising that as an OSError (to match the linux behavior)."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 01:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 02:18:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/1689 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-docs/1539 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-python26/1786 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-python27/1789 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/6002 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/10779 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/5721 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 02:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-02-28 03:41:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

probetests are failing with this patch (pass on tip of master)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 03:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/1691 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-docs/1541 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-python26/1788 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-swift-python27/1791 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/6013 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/10793 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/5732 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-28 04:22:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Probe tests work fine for me.  It's like having another Jenkins."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-02-28 04:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Probe tests seem fine here too.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-28 19:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Probe tests also pass for me (oneiric SAIO).'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-28 19:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Alright, so the old behavior of utils.fsync(fd) was:

Linux: os.fdatasync(fd)     # doesn't sync metadata
Darwin: fcntl(fd, F_FULLFSYNC)  # syncs everything really hard
BSDs [no fdatasync]: os.fsync(fd)         # syncs everything

The new behavior:

Linux: os.fsync(fd)     # now syncs everything
Darwin: fcntl(fd, F_FULLFSYNC)  # unchanged
BSDs: os.fsync(fd)      # unchanged 

So, the change is that, on Linux, utils.fsync() now syncs metadata just like you'd expect from something called "fsync".

Ship it!'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Removing my -1 since I seem to be the odd man out here. FWIW: I'm getting the following output on my SAIO (Lucid) https://gist.github.com/notmyname/71288f2472c146d063c1"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:21:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

After upgrading eventlet to 0.12.1 (from pypi), probetests work for me. Although others were reporting success with eventlet 0.11.0, I'm not sure what my issue was.

But, WFM/LGTM"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/gate/gate-swift-docs/1548 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/gate/gate-swift-pep8/1700 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/22963/4/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/5861 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
make swift fsync

Swift never fsyncs, it only fdatasyncs.  That is dumb, we have important
metadata we need to save.  Also, the code was weird and had no tests.

Change-Id: I6ec875c14560820b686266a28043a2b7631781e9

commit_message:
Gate on certain pyflakes failures

To prevent recent gating problems from typos, an
import not used and redefinition of function problems in
the source code have become gating.

Fixes: Bug #1131275
Change-Id: I7011f3ac5940afc70c38758e67a2222a66e625c3
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add heat-watch to pep8 checks

heat-watch was missing from pep8 checks in the past.  Tidy up heat-watch
and add to run_pep8.sh.

Change-Id: I36680b24ee90a5daeb7f8d7418b665a215026325
Fixes: Bug #1131275

commit_message:
Update infrastructure to more closely match other OpenStack projects

This patch imports nova's HACKING.rst guidelines altered for Heat.
This patch imports nova's run_pep8.sh with some minor alterations.
This patch imports nova's hacking.py extensions to pep8.

This patch places the run_pep8 logic in a separate file rather than
having it spread between tox.ini and run_tests.sh.  The HACKING.rst
requirements as well as general pep8 requirements are then enforced
with run_pep8.sh.

Avoid running once the N802 rule until dependency changelogs are
less then 50 characters.

Change-Id: If46c14668eae3cf11b8fbff46d766cc589d701aa
Fixes: Bug #1131275

commit_message:
Remove duplicate options(joinedload) from aggregates db code

_aggregate_get_query already does option joinedload.  So when use it don't
need to use additional options(joinedload).

Change-Id: I11a080c262122bf1b59984e5e80f6095527bf507

commit_message:
Stop builds in cells that don't have enough space

WORK IN PROGRESS

When choosing a cell to build a new instance in, make sure it has
enough RAM to take the new instance

To do:

 * needs tests
 * we should reduce the cell's capacity after issuing the build command

Change-Id: Ia1bf4494ba011b05a383cf77a98c639f8163d36b

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-27 18:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Sorry, I didn't even know there was an "optional" section in tests-requires.

I think my question is really just "will the normal set of tests still run if you don't have MySQL-Python" installed? If so, I think we shouldn't add the additional requirements to test-requires at all.

My justification is my usual use case, which may not be representative. What I typically do is to only try mysql tests when I'm testing out a new migration. In that case, I have to do extra work anyway--installing mysql, setting up the server, setting up a config file, etc. So it makes a lot of sense to add "install MySQL-python" to that extra work, and the other 99% of the time save the trouble of downloading and compiling another python C module.

Thanks, again. All the migration work looks great.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-27 18:54:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

If you don't have the database setup or the python package isn't installed the test just skips. There still is the extra manual setup step on dev systems of creating the openstack_citest database. If you don't create that db with the same for username and password the tests won't run either. I get what you're saying about it not being required for the normal tests, but it really needs to be on one of the pip lists for CI testing.

We want to make sure that the CI runs are also running this testing with mysql and postgres. I already hit a bug in migration 018 because these tests were turned on in CI. (InnoDB is turned off by default on the CI mysql db) CI can't tell if an incoming patch is a migration or not so it's better to enforce the migration testing with all the DB types on all patches. If we don't enforce this then more bugs can creep into the migrations in the future, we can't rely on devs running the tests on their local systems. IMO the increase in runtime is negligible (especially compared to how long it takes tempest to run) compared the benefits gained by running the tests in CI."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-28 17:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 17:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
Enable support for MySQL with test migrations.

This commit makes the necessary changes to enable the migrations
tests to pass with both mysql and sqlite. However the proper mysql
database still needs to be created beforehand for the tests to run
with mysql.

The sqlalchemy alter() method breaks on sqlite when mysql is enabled
for other databases. So for sqlite testing the alter() calls are now
done manually.

This also adds the MySQL-python module to the test-requires list
so that it will get installed for CI and the virtualenv used for
unit tests.

Change-Id: Ic72476b8e6a910c25747641ef1882639019b433e

commit_message:
heat clients : make boto client library pass disable_rollback

Make the boto_client.py wrapper correctly interpret the DisableRollback
argument, so the --disable-rollback option of heat-boto will work

fixes bug 1131283

Change-Id: If31daa1583ff836fbb3f67799b89602b16f904e3

implement it, not hard-code to True

fixes bug 1135963

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 15:18:00.000000000', 'message': "heat tools : openstack script install mysql via openstack-db

Don't install mysql-server in tools/openstack, instead allow
openstack-db to non-interactively install it for us, which means
the root password is set as per the -r password option when
installing on a fresh system with no mysql

NOTE : if testing this on a system which has had mysql installed,
do yum remove mysql-server && rm -fr /var/lib/mysql or the
reinstalled mysql will use the old credentials

fixes bug 1133502

Change-Id: Ie3ba56e5f971e032be4f099e81cbb24afe76dfbc
"}]
commit_message:
heat tools : openstack script install mysql via openstack-db

Don't install mysql-server in tools/openstack, instead allow
openstack-db to non-interactively install it for us, which means
the root password is set as per the -r password option when
installing on a fresh system with no mysql

NOTE : if testing this on a system which has had mysql installed,
do yum remove mysql-server && rm -fr /var/lib/mysql or the
reinstalled mysql will use the old credentials

fixes bug 1133502

Change-Id: Ie3ba56e5f971e032be4f099e81cbb24afe76dfbc

commit_message:
Shrink size of aggregate_metadata_get_by_host sql query

* Remove unnecessary secondary joins in Aggregate model.
* Remove unnecessary backrefs (only needed to create bidirectional relationship)

aggregate_metadata_get_by_host goes from 6 JOINS down to two JOINS.

Fix bug 1133495

Change-Id: I72966fa205973ec638816b07bfdcd54f1102feb5

commit_message:
ec2 _format_security_group() accesses db when using quantum_driver

This patch fixes _format_security_group() so that it does not
access the db when using quantum. In addition, this patch implements
the querying params that were missing in get() and list() in the quantum
security group driver.

Fixes bug 1131956

Change-Id: I5ec65829301bca7e5b215d5052a18528dff76517

commit_message:
Remove compat cfg wrapper

This wrapper was there to allow oslo-config changes through the gate
while keystoneclient hadn't been updated.

Also update to 2013.1b4.

Change-Id: I3d48673af58ae379e8e4d2c7fb4b4d81f3ed67dd

Note that eventlet has bugs (or technically maybe does not support (yet)) things like use of threading.Lock and threading.RLock in Threads (even with tpool).  Since the python logging module uses threading.RLock internally, that includes it.

Can you be sure that libguestfs does not use any of these things?  If it does, you'll experience complete code stall."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-26 08:08:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-25 12:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Run libguestfs API calls in a thread pool

The libguestfs API is a binding to a native C library, and thus
it will block greenthreads. To avoid this all libguestfs API
calls need to be run in a threadpool. This can be done by just
wrapping the GuestFS object in an eventlet.tpool.Proxy object

Fixes bug #1132742
Change-Id: I877ad9e88442e41c9ad234503d9b1ddf1fb27408
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Run libguestfs API calls in a thread pool

The libguestfs API is a binding to a native C library, and thus
it will block greenthreads. To avoid this all libguestfs API
calls need to be run in a threadpool. This can be done by just
wrapping the GuestFS object in an eventlet.tpool.Proxy object

Fixes bug #1132742
Change-Id: I877ad9e88442e41c9ad234503d9b1ddf1fb27408
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

I am happy with this patch, but holding on +2 to let you answer Nachi's question."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-28 18:09:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I personally am not a big fan of the general approach of setting check_exit_code to False, as I think it encourages masking errors.  I'd rather have us indicate that certain specific error codes are acceptable and should not be treated as a failure (in the case of routing the error code returned when a route already exists).  I had a patch that modified the execute() method to accept a list of allowed_error_codes.  To me that seemed cleaner, but given that we're near the end of grizzly, perhaps we should just go with the simple check_exit_code=False for now."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-28 18:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-28 18:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Backported from https://review.openstack.org/11759

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs
on a different server.

This also enables the run-tox.sh check for "Ran 0 tests" false
positives.

Change-Id: Ia9ed0527dc234fb6c744d0a0a700ba5edb3f7088

commit_message:
Pin glance dependency to pre-grizzly versions.

Fixes bug 1132835

* tools/pip-requires: Changes in recent glance prevent nose from
running tests in essex nova, resulting in a "Ran 0 tests" success
result. This change pins the dependency on glance to ensure grizzly
versions are not used in nova stable/essex.

Change-Id: Ia962287b5b23b5b536a4b7d3d10bb005c1c0eba9

commit_message:
Add check for image_locations table

This commit adds a check for the image_locations table to the
_assert_tables method in TestGlanceManage. When migration 018
was added in change: I1536c9276bc807aac26849e37556b465e8b5c9eb
a new image locations table was created, but didn't update the
functional tests to check that it had been created.

Change-Id: If76702f623e201505c62d05e245003e3783d8574

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 23:45:21.000000000', 'message': "Suppress retries on UnexpectedTaskStateErrors

Don't try to re-schedule if an UnexpectedTaskStateError occurs during
a build.  If the instance was deleted mid-build, just catch the
exception and log a message.

Change-Id: I5e577f252ee71f310a749186060808723b676854
"}]
commit_message:
Suppress retries on UnexpectedTaskStateErrors

Don't try to re-schedule if an UnexpectedTaskStateError occurs during
a build.  If the instance was deleted mid-build, just catch the
exception and log a message.

Change-Id: I5e577f252ee71f310a749186060808723b676854

subject: Prevent hacking.py from crashing on unexpected import exception
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 688, 'name': 'Sandy Walsh', 'email': 'sandy.walsh@rackspace.com', 'username': 'sandy-walsh'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-02-27 18:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Nice ... I was running into this a lot because of stevedore in Ceilometer.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-27 18:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23103/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/21720 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23103/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/8911 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-02-27 20:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-02-27 21:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-28 13:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

__import__ still executes the module, so for example, if the analyzed code decide to delete all of your files, it can do it. 

If the code decides to throw an Exception not a subclass of the Exception it still can cause issues.

If the code decides to exit it can do it.

If the code causes for example segmentation fail in a native code the default handler will termite the process.

Probably the real solution, would be to implement a find_module like function, which considers more import rules and can work both on Linux and OSX..'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

afazekas: I think the general case is we don't care what it does. Obviously there's a security hole there, but fixing it in hacking doesn't solve it everywhere. It would still happen if a malicious module was included in the project. That's more of a core reviewer problem than a code problem IMO.

As such, approving"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 16:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.

commit_message:
Prevent hacking.py from crashing on unexpected import exception

If a module isn't importable due to an unexpected error during
__import__.  Ignore it, hacking.py is only a style checker.

Fix bug 1134622

Change-Id: I704b7cc9a7bd415018ae7634767b7bd9c3b7d9b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 00:25:50.000000000', 'message': "Don't blindly skip first migration.

The existing code would, no matter-what, skip the first migration when
running through the migrations tests. This makes the code
slightly counterintuitive (why skip the first one?), and is not very
flexible.

The reworked logic lets a migration raise a `NotImplementedError` to
signal that it doesn't support a `downgrade`. This lets the
walk-versions code treat the first-migration just like any other.

Change-Id: I19fd8ebc6075392cf9e573b8b4166291584b4a83
"}]
commit_message:
Don't blindly skip first migration.

The existing code would, no matter-what, skip the first migration when
running through the migrations tests. This makes the code
slightly counterintuitive (why skip the first one?), and is not very
flexible.

The reworked logic lets a migration raise a `NotImplementedError` to
signal that it doesn't support a `downgrade`. This lets the
walk-versions code treat the first-migration just like any other.

Change-Id: I19fd8ebc6075392cf9e573b8b4166291584b4a83

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 23:36:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix `with_data` handling in test-migrations.

Two issues with the existing code:

1) migrate-down wasn't respecting the `with_data` flag

2) migrate-up was not actually migrating unless `with_data` was True.
The correct behavior is to always migrate up, but only run checks when
`with_data` is set.

Change-Id: I781fa4796908bea684d4499fa9ff5e4d7a18fbd4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix `with_data` handling in test-migrations.

Two issues with the existing code:

1) migrate-down wasn't respecting the `with_data` flag

2) migrate-up was not actually migrating unless `with_data` was True.
The correct behavior is to always migrate up, but only run checks when
`with_data` is set.

Change-Id: I781fa4796908bea684d4499fa9ff5e4d7a18fbd4

We've reached a general consensus not to use the try/except/else format for testing for expected exceptions. Would it be possible for you to rework it using self.assertRaises instead (and use addCleanup for the finally part)"}, {'account_id': 1822, 'date': '2013-02-26 09:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Christopher: I can rework. I am clear on replacing try/catch with self.assertRaises part but not clear on  addCleanUp() for finally.  Could you please elaborate? Do you want me to write a separate addCleanUp method and call this function from the test.'}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-26 22:01:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Suresh here is a sample of how addCleanup is used in another test to cleanup the created server needed for the test:


    @attr(type='negative')
    def test_delete_a_server_of_another_tenant(self):
        # Delete a server that belongs to another tenant
        server = self.create_server()
        self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_server(server['id']))
        self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound,
                              self.alt_client.delete_server,
                              server['id'])"}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-26 23:02:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sorry, it should be the following:

    @attr(type='negative')
    def test_delete_a_server_of_another_tenant(self):
        # Delete a server that belongs to another tenant
        server = self.create_server()
        self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_server,server['id'])
        self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound,
                              self.alt_client.delete_server,
                              server['id'])"}, {'account_id': 1822, 'date': '2013-02-28 09:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 09:50:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Add negative test in test_quotas.py.

This adds test for creating server when there is no more available instance quota
Fixes bug 1131112

Change-Id: I2a067ac73c1f1aeb25fca98fb84e3eaebbe7951e

Reverted the commit 49e330611319f4096061a92b4fad61a9c482b76f, and add a new
exception UnprocessableEntity.

Change-Id: I2b5944599a86f5805375f0d2d49e4ab38dc05825
'}]
commit_message:
Catching new exception while disassociating a disassociated floating ip

Because the response of disassociating floating ip api will be
changed(bug #1129719), so the tempest codes need to be updated synchronically.

Reverted the commit 49e330611319f4096061a92b4fad61a9c482b76f, and add a new
exception UnprocessableEntity.

Change-Id: I2b5944599a86f5805375f0d2d49e4ab38dc05825

commit_message:
heat engine : loadbalancer resource template, refer to StackId

Use the new AWS::StackId pseudo parameter to refer to the stack for
cfn-hup etc, otherwise the stack lookup by name will fail - using
the AWS::StackId parameter means we'll refer to the stack via the
full ARN and the CFN API will be able to lookup the nested stack.

ref bug 1131666

Change-Id: Ieac738df766ae1f1039e743d465cd080b2090473

commit_message:
heat engine : Re-resolve resource static data before create

Re-resolve the template static data before creating the resource,
or we resolve the wrong value for the AWS::StackId pseudo parameter
which is updated after the parser.Stack gets stored.

ref bug 1131666

Change-Id: I68e87366d379356fd7f2685367300abe5594d6f6

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:09:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So your change here seems ok, but kinda raises some questions about how the update stuff works.

So we do a parsed_template() on the current _and_ old snippet. I would have thought that we need the following:
1) snapshot of the old parsed template
2) as we update we get the latest new parsed template (as in this patch)
3) compare snapshot and updating template

Why? What if a resource references an attribute of another resource in it's metadata/properties? It needs to be updated based on the change in dynamic attributes.

I could be wrong but I think we are ignoring changes in dynamic attributes during the update.

parser.py:354
# Compare resolved pre/post update resource snippets,
# note the new resource snippet is resolved in the context
# of the existing stack (which is the stack being updated)"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-02-27 09:20:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ref asalkeld's comment - yes I think you're probably correct, the change here was really due to a situation such as you describe (where the AWS::StackId parameter Ref'd in the template Properties becomes dynamic due to the __init__/store() update)

Not sure the best way to proceed, but since the old behaviuor is already wrong, and this patch allows the LoadBalancer fixes to get merged, maybe we should merge this patch and I'll raise another bug describing the problem you identified, then I'll work on a new patch (and more tests) fixing the update problem."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-02-27 09:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
heat engine : Compare runtime resolved resource snippets on update

We need to compare the runtime resolved resource snippet, since that
is what we get back from self.parsed_template.  If we don't do this,
then we get a false positive when a Ref to a parameter which gets
updated (e.g AWS::StackId) is used in the resource properties.

ref bug 1131666

Change-Id: Ib488c43b9eca998a7a82b7571097f5bb69ef946c

commit_message:
heat engine : Set stack parameters AWS::StackId on stack create/store

We need to set the ARN provided via the AWS::StackId pseudo parameter
when the stack is stored, and also whenever a parser.Stack object is
created

ref bug 1131666

Change-Id: Ic8dc5ab2b25c85c51f2f685fe69bb2447a1e3615

commit_message:
heat engine : Add parser parameter support for AWS::StackId

Adds support for the AWS::StackId pseudo parameter, which will
allow us to to reference the stack ARN in the template, e.g so that
stacks can query their resource metadata via ARN not stack name,
which will solve the problem with nested resource being unable
to query their metadata.

ref bug 1131666

Change-Id: Ib7b1d380fa8766b6d0c968bd66270da8ce8245c4

commit_message:
Fix hogan js templates in IE8

Fixes: bug #1110226

Incorrect usage of the templating framework
as the html should be provided and not text? Weird
that it worked in other browsers though.

As part of the fix hogan has also been updated to
the latest official version 2.0.0 which may prevent
other bugs.

Upstream bug has been filed here:
https://github.com/twitter/hogan.js/issues/130

Change-Id: Id5b6cef85dab1f9a497a525f9c065b410c52b38f

Sorry Yong, I can't finish testing quantum-scheduler before merged..

It looks working but I have some opinion about client.

1.  dhcp-agent-list-hosting-net , l3-agent-list-hosting-router  are confusing 
How about add extra attribute on net-list,net-show,router-list,router-show ?

2. Until router is connected interface,   l3-agent-list-hosting-router show's nothing. In this case, the quantum should shows not-scheduled state or something."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Nachi Ueno, can u give out your naming solution?
amotoki and I have agree to them:
dhcp-agent-list-hosting-net means list dhcp agents hosting a given network.

regarding the empty list, we have the consistent style not to show anything if returned list is empty. For example, if quantum net-list returns empty list, we will not give a message 'we have no networks for you'."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for addressing the comment. The command name becomes better.

@nachi

I agree it is important to retrieve a list of scheduling status/host of all networks/routers.

In the current implementation, we can know router is scheduled or not but need to issue API calls per router: "quantum router-list-on-l3-agent <router_id>" and check if there is an output or not. I believe we have minimum support now.

However we need to call the above call per router. If we want to check all routers are scheduled correctly, we must call the API many times. It may be problematic.

Ideally it would be better to list scheduling status/host of all networks/routers. This change requires the change of the server side, and let's address in a later patch.

That is the reason I give +2 to this patch.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Approved

Thanks Nachi. I approve it.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Akihiro

It make sense for me. Let's work on listing on Hanova."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Yong

1) How about this?
quantum net-list shows
id , name, host.

quantum router-list shows
id , name, host.

2) Empty list
May be server side should show the data which shows the router is  un-scheduled status.
This behavior is not consistent with nova.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

1) quantum net-list shows id , name, host. quantum net-list is listing the networks, how to show id, name and host? it is also possible we have many dhcp agents hosting one network, it will make mess.

We can query additional api call when user invoke net-list with admin user.
Then we can add host. We can also show list on attribute such as fixed_ip.
In nova, we can see host as a attribute of instance, so this way may be more usable.

2) gongysh@controlnode:~/git/python-quantumclient$ nova list shows nothing if there is no server booted.

A instance stays scheduling state after boot for a short timing.
IMO, we should provide the way to show this router is not scheduled yet.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

1) quantum net-list shows id , name, host.
quantum net-list is listing the networks, how to show id, name and host? it is also possible we have many dhcp agents hosting one network, it will make mess.


2) 
gongysh@controlnode:~/git/python-quantumclient$ nova list
shows nothing if there is no server booted.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Run this command failed:
quantum net-dhcp-agent-list 84c0e164-d429-43b5-88d6-aeae2a73e1dd -v -d

ERROR: quantumclient.shell 'Client' object has no attribute 'list_networks_on_dhcp_agent'
DEBUG: quantumclient.shell clean_up ListNetworksOnDhcpAgent
DEBUG: quantumclient.shell got an error: 'Client' object has no attribute 'list_networks_on_dhcp_agent'"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

quantum l3-agent-list router1: 

request as:
'curl -i http://cloudcontroller:9696/v2.0/networks/c45348bb-403d-4c23-a606-4f5b6a8d4c09/l3agents.json -X GET '

It should be:
'curl -i http://cloudcontroller:9696/v2.0/routers/c45348bb-403d-4c23-a606-4f5b6a8d4c09/l3agents.json -X GET '"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

quantum dhcp-agent-network-add:

request as 'curl -i http://cloudcontroller:9696/v2.0/agents/1e4add02-3c4c-45eb-9e78-662f14a26169/dhcpnetworks.json -X PUT ...' 

It should be 'curl -i http://cloudcontroller:9696/v2.0/agents/1e4add02-3c4c-45eb-9e78-662f14a26169/dhcpnetworks.json -X POST ...'"}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-28 08:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified

commit_message:
Remove deprecated assertEquals alias.

We have code in the tree that uses both assertEquals and assertEqual. The
former is deprecated:

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

As it's a REALLY simple thing to fix, I went ahead and made it all happy.

Change-Id: Ibbd9461e2bda591693a6775b9ede1e87b8c008f2

Without creating a subtransaction, the database query wasn't actually
being run and the data was being lost.  This resulted in the case that
on termination of long running VMs, the VM IP address was immediately
available for reuse instead of being held as it should have been.

Fixes: bug #1116500

Change-Id: I7774273b8e799d945c27329e9da2dba34e39fdb8

"}]
commit_message:
Persist updated expiration time

Without creating a subtransaction, the database query wasn't actually
being run and the data was being lost.  This resulted in the case that
on termination of long running VMs, the VM IP address was immediately
available for reuse instead of being held as it should have been.

Fixes: bug #1116500

Change-Id: I7774273b8e799d945c27329e9da2dba34e39fdb8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

commit_message:
Convert from using FLAGS directly in SF driver.

In order for the Filter scheduler to be used to it's
full advantage Cinder drivers need to move away from
using FLAGS directly and switch to appending their
specific options to self.configuration.

This patch converts the driver and updates tests.

Fixes bug: 1131553

Change-Id: Id1a7c583894ac368bdcc61facc6f72300db320c7

commit_message:
Implements KVM set host enabled

KVM implementation for host status update (enabled/disabled)
which sets the host's ability to accept new instances requests

This implemenets blueprint host-maintenance

Change-Id: Ie3566bff2afb2c7a6eda2a1c803cfdf930030816

commit_message:
PLUMgrid VIF driver

PLUMgrid is a Network Virtualization Platform that requires direct communication
with the Hypervisor layer to provide all the networking functionality requested
by Quantum APIs. PLUMgrid is not a hypervisor, it is a network virtualization
platform based on a controller-mode.

Implements: blueprint plumgrid-vif-driver
Change-Id: Ib469828a1851a0f828f2d76cbf77719dee5d0a55
