revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 00:03:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix images/snapshots table pagination

For project images, disable pagination entirely as it's not compatible
with client-side filtering (at least without moving to asynch table
loading). This can be revisited when we move to glance v2, which
apparently supports filtering by owner.

For snapshots and admin images, fix pagination by making sure the
iterator returned by glanceclient isn't exhausted completely when
returning a page of images. Do this by slicing just the number of
images we require (+ 1 to check if there will be another page after
this one).

Fixes bug #1083034.

Change-Id: I692f57dec6dca16cf8909f5b234aadb002702fc8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix images/snapshots table pagination

For project images, disable pagination entirely as it's not compatible
with client-side filtering (at least without moving to asynch table
loading). This can be revisited when we move to glance v2, which
apparently supports filtering by owner.

For snapshots and admin images, fix pagination by making sure the
iterator returned by glanceclient isn't exhausted completely when
returning a page of images. Do this by slicing just the number of
images we require (+ 1 to check if there will be another page after
this one).

Fixes bug #1083034.

Change-Id: I692f57dec6dca16cf8909f5b234aadb002702fc8

commit_message:
create_server cleanup

back in Nov when Matt and I were tracking down the reasons for
intermitent failures in CI, I created a create_server_with_extras
function for resource tracking servers. It is well time to purge
that and make the basic create_server serve our needs.

This turns create_server into a kwargs full function, that includes
sane defaults, and wait_until kwarg to not return until a certain
state has been reached.

Change-Id: I208b266253c0e48da66d1dd4c84a3c074c38d1a6

commit_message:
Retry floating_ip_fixed_ip_associate on deadlock.

Update the floating_ip_fixed_ip_associate method of the sqlalchemy db
API to retry if it fails because of a deadlock.  The decorator that
handles this was introduced in e53e22271ed7e7a9b919d817a8eb50a1ecce16f8.
The related bug report shows that this method could benefit from the use
of this decorator.

Fix bug 1090016.

Change-Id: I0159470e6eb2f8017bcb3e659e7b119194dda920

commit_message:
Use a fake coverage module instead of real one.

Actually loading the coverage module was leading to odd concurrency
conditions where it was interfering with mocked calls. This changes
to stub out the coverage class with a fake one so that we don't have
to worry about collisions. It also modifies the coverage class to be
created lazily so it isn't automatically started at import time.
Finally it removes the hack in run_tests.sh ignoring the coverage
tests.

Fixes bug 1131023

Change-Id: I39de434454f8b0903f6311e731e215a93027bc91

Improve bin/swift-account-audit

2.Fix typo.
3.Align lines of print_status part. (keep origin author mind)

      in Gerrit. I import his commit and send it in right Workflow.

commit_message:
Put heat data files in /var/lib/heat-cfntools

The /var/lib/heat-cfntools directory should be owned by the
heat-cfntools package for whichever distro it is included.

This avoids the problem of heat writing to directories owned
by cloud-init.

Change-Id: Iac04b59b9d805bec99ff13f5a8d771f7986230ce
Fixes: Bug #1105806

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 11:45:17.000000000', 'message': "Unpin suds dependency version

Fixes bug #1133247

suds is used by the vmware driver and the dependency has always been
pinned to 0.4:

  67e63ba8 (Sateesh Chodapuneedi 2011-03-07 18:10:48 +0530 17) suds==0.4

0.4 was released in September 2010 and there hasn't been a release
since. In fact, there has only been 16 commits since then and none of
them look to break the existing API.

If there's no reason to expect the next version to break us, we should
unpin. Indeed, we want to know early if upstream does break its API.

Change-Id: Icd2bdd021093293b2e4261a00d063239a3c42ce6
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin suds dependency version

Fixes bug #1133247

suds is used by the vmware driver and the dependency has always been
pinned to 0.4:

  67e63ba8 (Sateesh Chodapuneedi 2011-03-07 18:10:48 +0530 17) suds==0.4

0.4 was released in September 2010 and there hasn't been a release
since. In fact, there has only been 16 commits since then and none of
them look to break the existing API.

If there's no reason to expect the next version to break us, we should
unpin. Indeed, we want to know early if upstream does break its API.

Change-Id: Icd2bdd021093293b2e4261a00d063239a3c42ce6

[{'created': '2013-02-26 11:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Unpin Cheetah dependency version

Fixes bug #1133216

We've been pinned to the same version of Cheetah since May 2011:

  Cheetah==2.4.4

this was released in December 2010 and there hasn't been a release since:

  https://pypi.python.org/pypi/Cheetah/2.4.4

There's no particular reason to believe a future release of Cheetah will break
us (only 6 commits since 2.4.4 and they all look like bugfixes), so we should
change to:

  Cheetah>=2.4.4

Change-Id: Id3b22b84d2d693776f89ccb1d0c99d4e42fcab62
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin Cheetah dependency version

Fixes bug #1133216

We've been pinned to the same version of Cheetah since May 2011:

  Cheetah==2.4.4

this was released in December 2010 and there hasn't been a release since:

  https://pypi.python.org/pypi/Cheetah/2.4.4

There's no particular reason to believe a future release of Cheetah will break
us (only 6 commits since 2.4.4 and they all look like bugfixes), so we should
change to:

  Cheetah>=2.4.4

Change-Id: Id3b22b84d2d693776f89ccb1d0c99d4e42fcab62

commit_message:
Add missing import to fakelibvirt.

This module calls time.sleep(1), but was not importing the time module.
This fixes it.

Fix bug 1133056.

Change-Id: Ifbba2a98ccdd8d5e26ce466831618ccab9e0b462

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 03:33:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix footer count update for multi-table pages

The initial footer count update was selecting all tables on the page
at once for the update, so the count was a sum of all visible rows
on the page.

Fixes bug #1131522.

Change-Id: Iff85ec8533ed62c01d91a21d7f7ea35dcfbf1417
'}]
commit_message:
Fix footer count update for multi-table pages

The initial footer count update was selecting all tables on the page
at once for the update, so the count was a sum of all visible rows
on the page.

Fixes bug #1131522.

Change-Id: Iff85ec8533ed62c01d91a21d7f7ea35dcfbf1417

Account Server: Refactor HEAD request handler

swift::common::db::AccountBroker::get_container_timestamp becomes
unused, it is deleted too, along with the corresponding tests.

Convert api to controller

Auth test case was using the member for a controller
but had called it API, which was confusing

Bug 1133395

Due to recent changes in notification logic between Quantum and the DHCP

network was not working anymore and needed to be replaced

Change-Id: Ifa0ea55116cf5ef6d546d28ca52e643987b3e5a0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NVP plugin not notifying metadata access network to DHCP agent

Bug 1133395

Due to recent changes in notification logic between Quantum and the DHCP
agent, the notifier the NVP plugin previously used for metadata access
network was not working anymore and needed to be replaced

Change-Id: Ifa0ea55116cf5ef6d546d28ca52e643987b3e5a0

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Could there be a backward-compatibility issue with the container_info key rename (from "count" to "object_count")?

For one thing, at least one other place still expects a key "count" to be in there (swift/common/middleware/ratelimit.py:123-124).  There could be others?  Possibly in middleware not in core swift?

Then, what if swift is upgraded but memcached instance(s) aren't restarted--the new code will find cached dicts, but they won't have the new key in them... I didn't audit all the code which might be affected (is it only the container quota stuff?), but it seems like that could cause undesirable behavior.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Please ignore my last comment... I apparently completely forgot our exchange in inline comments on Patchset 1 ;).

So just to make sure we're on the same page: headers_to_container_info() was only recently introduced w/redbo's quota patch, so changing the interface now presents no backward-compatibility issues?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

yes exactly the container_info functions was not introduced before last week, so i would not believe anyone else using it.

Having says that it would be good if we move all get_account/container_info and headers_to_(container/account) info in an another class like swift.proxy.controllers.utils or an another name, just to let know other people those are functions that may be exposed to middleware external to swift.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hrm... but what about ratelimit.py's accessing of the cached container info (via the key returned by get_container_memcache_key())?

Doesn't that represent an existing user of the dict cached at that key, even though the method headers_to_container_info() is new?  I guess headers_to_container_info() used the key "count" because existing code which cached a dict to the same key was already using the key "count"?'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:56:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

staticweb._get_container_info seems to do its own thing and store the memcache_key in another space ("/staticweb/") I was mentioning that on container_quota's review, we probably want to have it to use get_container_info from swift.proxy.base'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:59:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

answering kun comment, you may want to log a bug if you feel there is one there but I don't think this patch change anything in this part of the code."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

What do you think about making internal_client.py's get_account_info able to look into the memcached store for container and object counts?  It currently appears to be used by the object expirer, and taking advantage of this caching could reduce account server HEAD load when a deployer has object expiration enabled.

I'm not sure if internal client's proxy app has access to the proxies' memcache ring, though..."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

nice idea, will give it a try.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

wip'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-15 10:25:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I had a look at object_expirer and AFAICS it only query metadata to the special '.expiring_objects' account, so effectively if we do this change it will not be bring benefits for the other accounts and i'm not sure if we want to do memcaching HEAD metadata for the object-expiring."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

You're right, and that account's metadata is only fetched once per run-once.  So nevermind :)"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-02-16 09:01:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Ready For Review

commit_message:
Account and container info fixes and improvement.

- Fixes bug 1119282.
- Allow middleware accessing metadata of an account without having to
  store it separately in a new memcache namespace.
- Add tests for get_container_info that was previously missed.
- Add get_account_info method based on get_container_info, a function
  for other middleware to query accounts.
- Rename container_info['count'] as container_info['object_count'].

Change-Id: I43787916c7a812cb08d278edf45370521f12c912

code looks fine.  I'd be ok with validation happening in the plugin as well though, as rkukura suggests."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

ok, thanks bob.  so we're good to approve?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

reverify'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

do we know that all plugins provide the correct validation within the plugin for grizzly?  Bob mentioned the ML2 plugin, but I"m not sure about the others.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Why not simply remove the validation of the network_type in the core, and let each plugin validate this based on the types it supports? Does the core have any need to know this list other than to do this validation? Last I looked, existing plugins that implement the provider extension already do this validation and return an appropriate error if the network_type isn't supported. Note that the supported network types can depend on configuration (i.e. enable_tunneling in openvswitch or the set of TypeDrivers loaded in ml2). The WIP ml2 patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20105/ changes the network_type validation in the core to simply validate a string. Is anything more really needed?"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Salvatore,

I think it best if you simply change the API layer's network_type validation in your patch from type:values to type:string, as I did in the WIP ml2 patch. It would be great to get this into grizzly, so that out-of-tree plugins can support new network_type values.

-Bob"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If no plugin supports the entire current built-in list of possible network_type values, then every existing plugin must be validating that the supplied network_type value is one that it supports and raising an exception if the type is not on supported. I believe those existing checks in the plugins are sufficient, and nothing would break with the current patch set.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I just verified that all in-tree plugins supporting providernet raise InvalidInput with an appropriate message if the network_type value is anything other than the types they support.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I agree with Dan.
This change looks not backward-compatible.

how about import valid list from conf?'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Bob
It looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make network types in provider network extension configurable

Bug 1133064

This patch solves the issue of having plugin-specific network types in
the list of valid values specified by the providernet extension.
In this way, the extension descriptor can fetch the list of valid values
from the plugin rather than hardcoding them.

Change-Id: I3ce5762458bc553625a458ace80072bd804e31f0
'}, {'created': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove network type validation from provider networks extension

depends on the particular plugin, validation should be performed there.

Change-Id: I3ce5762458bc553625a458ace80072bd804e31f0
'}, {'created': '2013-02-27 00:15:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make network types in provider network extension configurable

from the plugin rather than hardcoding them.

'}]
commit_message:
Remove network type validation from provider networks extension

Bug 1133064

As the set of valid network types for the provider networks extension
depends on the particular plugin, validation should be performed there.

Change-Id: I3ce5762458bc553625a458ace80072bd804e31f0

commit_message:
Sync nova with oslo DB exception cleanup.

DB exceptions have moved to openstack/common/db/exception module so that
they can be shared with multiple DB implementations.

Deadlock checking was also added to oslo to consolidate with
DuplicateKey checking.  This allows us to clean up our
_retry_on_deadlock decorator in sqlalchemy/api.py

Fixes unrelated pep8 issue with duplicate test in test_compute also.

Change-Id: I7e985b384d1ef345e0d67c919b84b4faff869699

commit_message:
pin django to 1.4.x stream

django 1.5 just released in the last hour, and there is a
compatibility issue with it and horizon causing gate failures.

Pin this so that we can get back to business and let the horizon
team address django 1.5 when it makes sense to them.

Change-Id: I6ddf9623f8a4719b1cb82b118c1876373051fd28

heat engine : Make loadbalancer nested template raw string

Make the nested template a raw string so we don't need to remember
to double backslash everything

Devstack element pulls from master.

Devstack element pulls devstack from trunk
instead of from the tripleo fork.

Using the IMAGE_TYPE env variable, you can select which ouput disk format you want for your image.
Only qcow2 format supports compression.

Change-Id: Ia01d9079c354dbd3cfcf870d86f97ee57bd9d479
'}]
commit_message:
Support multiple outputs disk formats

Using the IMAGE_TYPE env variable, you can select which ouput disk format you want for your image.
Only qcow2 format supports compression.

Change-Id: Ia01d9079c354dbd3cfcf870d86f97ee57bd9d479

commit_message:
Install heat-cfntools from pypi

Then creates symlinks into /opt/aws/bin using the included script.

This replaces the heat-jeos element, so anything that references heat-jeos will need to be replaced with heat-cfntools

Change-Id: Id286b005f69ea364357303b4bbc1ed29d4f0f8f9

subject: Added new method for installing devstack.  Leaving old methods in for compatibility, but will look to deprecate them if this change is accepted
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22441/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/4524 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22441/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/4243 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22441/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/9052 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-02-20 18:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

See my inline comment'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 11:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This needs much better formatting. We don't use hard tabs, try to stay under 80 cols (though not hard constraint), and functions look like this:

# Service wrapper to start services
# start_service service-name
function start_service() {
    if is_ubuntu; then
        sudo /usr/sbin/service $1 start
    else
        sudo /sbin/service $1 start
    fi
}

Please try to match with the rest of the style in the project."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-02-26 15:10:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

A few comments to help shape a new version.

looks like there are lots of strange defaults in here."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-02-26 16:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (8 inline comments)

There is a bootstrapping problem with having multiple files - there are too many different localrc's in XenServer installation guides, in part because the file has to exist in parallel with the script that's performing the installation.

I'm keen to have a single file that can be used _outside_ of dom0 to setup everything in dom0 and devstack.

This will mean that the installation instructions are "wget file XYZ and run it with ABC arguments" rather than download the whole of devstack then cd to devstack/*/tools/xen then create a localrc - only for devstack to be cloned to where it's really needed, in the DomU.

I don't think it's as desirable but on reflection of the comments it seems that devstack isn't the appropriate place for this script - so if we still want to, we can look at hosting it elsewhere'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-02-26 16:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-02-26 21:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

I know you abandoned, but just wanted to respond to your comments.

I think it is a useful idea, just wondering about the best way to cater for both those who want to run devstack in dom0 and those who want to run it from a separate machine.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 16:05:35.000000000', 'message': 'Added new method for installing devstack.  Leaving old methods in for compatibility, but will look to deprecate them if this change is accepted

Change-Id: I55a080590a87c30634ef3db7ab458247da2bba1d
'}]
commit_message:
Added new method for installing devstack.  Leaving old methods in for compatibility, but will look to deprecate them if this change is accepted

Change-Id: I55a080590a87c30634ef3db7ab458247da2bba1d

commit_message:
Add an openstack all-openstack-db element:

This element installs all openstack sql databases into
a single image, useful for a bootstrap image.

Change-Id: I6efe807793ec620a60d5798d28a7e3103a5b90e8

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-08 21:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/315/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think think the proposed values here are really satisfactory

This separation of "os_distro" and "os_version" may seem like a good idea, but it doesn't really work very nicely when you consider Windows. Although Windows releases do have versions, they are not the versions that users think of, and the version number is the same for products that most people consider different, so they don't provide a good unique identifier. ie Windows 2k8 and Window Vista are both considered version 6.0 by Microsoft.

The libosinfo library (http://libosinfo.org/) has gone to the trouble of putting together a database of operating systems, with a tonne of metadata about each one. It defines 2 unique identifiers for each OS, a URL based ID, and a plain string "short-id". eg id == http://microsoft.com/win/2k8 and short-id == win2k8 . (http://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/libosinfo.git/tree/data/oses/windows.xml.in)

Rather than having openstack invent new vocabulary for this OS data, I'd prefer to see openstack simply declare that it uses the same data vocabulary as libosinfo. NB, openstack doesn't need to depend on libosinfo libraries - it merely needs to follow same vocabulary. I can provide a canonical list of os names if required (or the command 'osinfo-query os' will print it). Since the libvirt driver will be making use of libosinfo in the future, it will be very beneficial to have this consistency and it doesn't negatively impact other virt drivers in OpenStack to follow libosinfo naming conventions).


WRT to 'arch' I proposed values are rather incomplete, and the choice of 'x86-64' over the much more common 'x86_64' is dubious. Since basically all of the Nova hypervisors are i686/x86_64 only, with the exception of the libvirt driver I'd like to see the recommended arch names, follow those defined by libvirt to simplify its & avoid the need to translate architectures from one name to another.  

Thus my proposal is the following list of arch names

alpha
armv7l
cris
i686
ia64
lm32
m68k
microblaze
microblazeel
mips
mipsel
mips64
mips64el
openrisc
parisc
parisc64
ppc
ppc64
ppcemb
s390
s390x
sh4
sh4eb
sparc
sparc64
unicore32
x86_64
xtensa
xtensaeb

Taken from this file  http://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=blob;f=src/util/virarch.c;hb=HEAD#l31'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:48:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In fact WRT to 'os_arch' there is already an 'architecture' metadata property defined earlier in this doc, so defining 'os_arch' is redundant. The earlier doc simply needs to be expanded to detail the full list of architctures."}, {'account_id': 1803, 'date': '2013-02-16 02:43:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Second Daniel's comment - seems like we should stick with architecture since it is already defined, but I can go either way as long as it is only defined once.

Added in-line comment on powerpc - if it was intended for powervm driver it should be ppc64 and if not, ppc64 should be added."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-19 10:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 10:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Given ongoing disagreement over naming, I'd prefer to see the os_libosinfo_shortid docs removed until such time that we actually have code that will want to use it."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

Alvaro: comments inline
Daniel: still thinking'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Work In Progress

Corrected hyperlinks, waiting to hear from Glance PTL about Daniel's reservation about the os_libosinfo_shortid property name."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/456/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21550/6/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/8 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-22 16:01:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would really prefer if such discussions were actually happening in a public forum where people can participate rather than private conversations."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-22 22:39:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Daniel - as far as a public forum is concerned, we had two mailing list threads regarding this:

http://markmail.org/message/5bd5zkyre57ppi3n
http://markmail.org/message/zjbcg2kkmpbhfrj3

I would also regard the blueprint and review as public forums:

blueprint glance-common-image-properties
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21547/

At this point, I am not excited about having os_libosinfo_shortid as a documented property in Glance. I think we need to remove it altogether, from the docs and the code until we figure out how to properly represent it. Regardless of what we end up doing, these documents are intended to represent what the project does. This is not the place to redesign this feature."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-22 22:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Daniel, I think we're at cross-purposes here.  These docs only describe what's going on in Glance, so if you feel strongly about the property name (which I think you do!), please file a bug in Glance (something like "common image property 'os_libosinfo_shortid' should be named 'os_name') and I'll be happy to put a message out on the openstack_dev list to see what the community at large thinks the name of the property should be.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2013-02-26 21:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

Underlying docs have changed; will resubmit a fresh commit.'}]

commit_message:
Fix redstack reddwarf keystone registration line

Due to the way python-keystoneclient parses its arguments,
trying to register our service with the function call
keystone_manage and a verbose description fails.

Fixes: bug #1133029

Change-Id: If31e566cffd60aa810f0c698f8d000f099a658d5

[{'created': '2013-02-25 22:37:02.000000000', 'message': 'Restore folsom compatibility for the nova notifier

This patch splits the notifier implementations between
the one that worked in folsom and the one that works in
grizzly to maintain backwards compatibility. It is
presented separately to demonstrate one way to do this,
and in case we decide not to bother.

commit_message:
Restore folsom compatibility for the nova notifier

This patch splits the notifier implementations between
the one that worked in folsom and the one that works in
grizzly to maintain backwards compatibility. It is
presented separately to demonstrate one way to do this,
and in case we decide not to bother.

Change-Id: I8121501cd3ed0b6f18dc29db0bfbd043ec93b5d3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Fix for setup.py not finding the .git directories

This commit fixes the bug where setup.py could not find the .git directories
and broke run_tests.py in quantum.

Change-Id: I77329d301c0114074efea7eb019caa057f552b5f
Fixes: Bug #1131162

https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1098962"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:47:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Flavio, thanks for your review.

From https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22182/ it looks like an alternative scheme for location won't happen at least until Havana.

If we reject this patch (or an equivalent) doesn't it mean that most users who enable notifications would have to live with this potential security issue for eight months or so?"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:57:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey :)

Yes, you're right, that patch wont land until Havana.

If it's a security issue (which it is) a security patch could be released if the OSSA team approves so. 

My thoughts are not exactly about the patch (which looks good) itself but about fixing this from the root instead of patch glance with stuff that we will (probably) have to remove.

@bcwaldon: thoughts?


Just tying to think the best way to do this in terms of workflow."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-21 19:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-21 19:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-22 14:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-glance-pep8/3751 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-glance-docs/1811 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-glance-python26/3244 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-glance-python27/3262 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/5046 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/4765 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22298/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/9641 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-22 19:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Stuart,

Thanks for getting after this.

I'd like to see a much broader solution where we either 1) get rid of the need for credentials, or 2) move credentials into a separate field from location.

However, for rc1/grizzly I see value in moving forward with something like this patch, with a few further modifications:

- change redact_location so that it simply removes 'location' from a copy of the image dict
- move redact_location into a v1 helper location, rather than global utils
- just don't insert 'location' into the payload in glance/notifier/__init__.py _format_image_notification rather than using a utility function

I strongly prefer this last item because the whole "modify a copy of the image dict" part is only necessary in light of the absurd v1 behavior of notifying with objects that came literally straight out of the database. Notifications in the domain layer don't follow this practice and so don't require the additional safeguard.

I'm also happy to make these changes myself, if you prefer.

Cheers,
markwash'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-22 19:27:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:22:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm in favor of markwash's proposal here."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-23 10:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think the whole location issue should be thought a bit better so we can fix it once and for all and avoid this kind of issues.

I agree with mark as well.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-25 14:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Mark -- as always, thanks for your feedback Mark.

I think I need some clarification on how to reconcile your feedback with Brian's before pushing up another patch set. In the bug (https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1125130) I list three options:

-----

Options I see here are:

1) remove the location parameter altogether
2) leave it in but ensure it is encrypted when the metadata encryption is set on
3) leave it in and just remove the value (set to "redacted" or "****")

Possibly 3 may be the best option since it doesn't change the existing format and is secure whether metadata encryption is on or off.

-------

And got the following feedback from Brian:

----
I think I will support option 3, but with the caveat that we use the same format as the config secret sanitizer.
----

This is what I've tried to do with the current patch. It looks like you favour option '1' here. I'm happy to change to that, once I get the ok from Brian to do so. ('3' is my personal preference -- just in case someone has some metering/billing code that expects the current format, but I'm not overly concerned either way).'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-25 19:11:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks Stuart.

Sorry, when I first looked into this I didn't read up on the bug discussion, so I missed out on the context where you proposed the options. I hope it wasn't too frustrating to see my comment!

I think I may have managed to convince Waldon to go with simply removing location--see his comment above."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-25 19:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yep - I defer to markwash's suggestion here"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-26 10:41:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mark/Brian, thanks for the clarification. (I think any confusion here was my fault -- I missed one of Brian's comments.)

I'll push up another change."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-26 13:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 14:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Redact location from notifications

Redact the value of 'location' in notifications since it may contain
credentials.

Fix for bug 1125130.

Change-Id: Ic0baee259ac46479f8992eca2b02c307fcaf70ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 19:03:44.000000000', 'message': 'Quantum run_tests fails to get git versions.

Quantum run_tests failse to get any git versions as it runs in a subdirectory
where .git is not present. This commit changes setup.py to search for a .git
folder recursively till either one is found or / is hit.

Change-Id: I3c3ae0095091edc91e454c8c47c22f8e2a693b80
Fixes: Bug #1131162
'}]
commit_message:
Quantum run_tests fails to get git versions.

Quantum run_tests failse to get any git versions as it runs in a subdirectory
where .git is not present. This commit changes setup.py to search for a .git
folder recursively till either one is found or / is hit.

Change-Id: I3c3ae0095091edc91e454c8c47c22f8e2a693b80
Fixes: Bug #1131162

commit_message:
Force earlier version of sqlalchemy

Fixes bug 1073569

Backported from https://review.openstack.org/15097

Set the version of sqlalchemy to be earlier than the 0.8 beta as it
is incompatible with the latest available sqlalchemy-migrate and as
a result run_tests.sh does not run any tests.

Change-Id: I3cb367306c4e3801c9979bba0bd03a11fcea9aa2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-25 22:35:43.000000000', 'message': "Update stress tests to properly use tempest.config

When tempest.config was switched over to using oslo the stress tests
weren't updated with those changes. Also subsequent changes to the
tempest options were not updated in the stress test suite. This left
the stress tests unusable because it couldn't get the needed
information from config. This commit updates the stress test suite
to properly use tempest.config. It also adds a new section to the
config file for stress test specific options.

Fixes bug 1133012

Change-Id: I1b0c726f53dc0e3e0777e27af3e860d35029f958
"}]
commit_message:
Update stress tests to properly use tempest.config

When tempest.config was switched over to using oslo the stress tests
weren't updated with those changes. Also subsequent changes to the
tempest options were not updated in the stress test suite. This left
the stress tests unusable because it couldn't get the needed
information from config. This commit updates the stress test suite
to properly use tempest.config. It also adds a new section to the
config file for stress test specific options.

Fixes bug 1133012

Change-Id: I1b0c726f53dc0e3e0777e27af3e860d35029f958

move sysstat earlier (but not too early)

sysstat was starting too late to understand the state of the system
when services didn't start. Move it to earlier.

Change-Id: Iaf8e72c441dbdf943f7f25ea3f0fc568138a178f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-25 16:39:59.000000000', 'message': 'Flush tokens on instance delete

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix bug 1125378, where the console for
the wrong instance can be connected to via the
console if the correct circumstances occur. This
change also adds a call to validate the token
when it is used. This check will ensure that all
tokens are valid for their target instances.
Tokens can become scrambled when a compute node is
restarted, because the virt driver may not
assign ports in the same way.

Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96
Fixes: bug #1125378

commit_message:
Flush tokens on instance delete

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix bug 1125378, where the console for
the wrong instance can be connected to via the
console if the correct circumstances occur. This
change also adds a call to validate the token
when it is used. This check will ensure that all
tokens are valid for their target instances.
Tokens can become scrambled when a compute node is
restarted, because the virt driver may not
assign ports in the same way.

Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96
Fixes: bug #1125378

commit_message:
heat engine : fix variable/import shadowing in service.py

The resources import is shadowed by a variable declaration in
validate template, which is confusing, so add a prefix to
differentiate the variable from the import

bug 1133434

Change-Id: Ia7c451c3a2588ddff114da9897b3bcf58e68cf0c

subject: Add 'issued_at` attribute to tokens
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 16:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22039/1/check/gate-noop/509 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-02-16 01:14:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-16 01:36:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's why I wanted to discuss this issue distinctly. Adam introduced this attribute in v2, mostly as a workaround to force two otherwise identical tokens to be unique (as they will likely be issued at different times).

Two alternatives are either to allow two tokens to be identical (I'm not super familiar with what the problem is there -- I'll let Adam explain), or to make the tokens unique in some other manner (including a UUID?)."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-16 01:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

... introduced this attribute in v2 *in support of PKI* ...'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-18 16:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"issued_at is only in there to ensure that the token is unique if reissued and rehashed in rapid succession, as otherwise there is a uniqueness constraint.  This is due to the fact that we don't reissue tokens, but instead always generte a new one.   I would say it does not matter where it goes, so long as it stays in the token. I don't see people referencing it directly." -ayoung'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add 'issued_at` attribute to tokens

This also renames 'expires' to 'expires_at' in both tokens and trusts.

(Also wrapped a token in a container that was previously missed.)

Change-Id: Ifa320ac32a49a7f84be51b9c93dfe06abd54a218

commit_message:
heat engine : reinstate resources import

Reinstate the resources import removed by 06f4f85, without this
we fail to create any resources (GenericResource is created for
all resources due to no resource plugins being imported).

bug 1133434

Change-Id: I2b24d58dee83a426deee09f8a9a121f503534de4

commit_message:
Additional tests for safe parsing with minidom

For nova, forbid_dtd is going to be true always, however
if someone picks up this code and tries forbid_dtd = False
then the existing code is not good enough. we need to protect
against external entities/dtd and not allow notations as well.
Added a few more handlers and test cases to cover that use
case.

Change-Id: If50f690e015f2bf837b403edf552e35d7af8c907

commit_message:
Fix broken JSON schemas in v2 tests

* The required attribute is not allowed in draft 4 of JSON schema
* The dependency on jsonschema can be relaxed back to all versions

Change-Id: Id0767cfe2fe46d73999563896f851ffb01aa9489

commit_message:
Simplify xml-json inheritance in identity

_interface just specified in the real test classes.
Merge role tests to single class, inorder to avoid unintended duplicated test execution.

Change-Id: I26f01424dcd3981d402cd771fa689f178eb52e47

Implements test_update_all_metadata_field_error.

Replace all metadata for a server with blank key metadata
forcing a error.

Blueprint missing-tempest-tests

[{'created': '2013-02-25 23:26:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow zk driver be imported without zookeeper

The zookeeper python module isn't widely available (e.g. not available
on Fedora), so allow the zk servicegroup driver be imported even if the
module isn't found.

This helps allow the generate_sample.sh script generate a sample config
file even without zookeeper installed.

Change-Id: Ic3b3bb75bcd2003150909ebd2c5724fa5093c346
"}, {'created': '2013-02-26 07:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Allow zk driver be imported without zookeeper

The zookeeper python module isn't widely available (e.g. not available
on Fedora), so allow the zk servicegroup driver be imported even if the
module isn't found.

This helps allow the generate_sample.sh script generate a sample config
file even without zookeeper installed.

Change-Id: Ic3b3bb75bcd2003150909ebd2c5724fa5093c346
"}]
commit_message:
Allow zk driver be imported without zookeeper

The zookeeper python module isn't widely available (e.g. not available
on Fedora), so allow the zk servicegroup driver be imported even if the
module isn't found.

This helps allow the generate_sample.sh script generate a sample config
file even without zookeeper installed.

Change-Id: Ic3b3bb75bcd2003150909ebd2c5724fa5093c346

commit_message:
flatten payload for policy

allows the policy rules to run over a JSON payload.
Nestes values en up in dotted notation

Change-Id: I9a2ec870c79369d308a23cd742aaeda25400f33a

commit_message:
Minor code optimization in _compute_topic

In cases where a valid host is passed, the if
statement is always executed twice, not once like it should

Change-Id: I6a24bb4f85bfb94d2fdc5d1652ee371f296a10ef

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-17 23:52:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with afazekas. There is little point to numbering the tests as they may be run in a different order anyway. All tests should be written such that they can be run in parallel with each other. They should also clean up after themselves whether they pass or fail."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-19 06:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Food for thoughts, but after switching away from nose, there is a supported unittest way to explicitly order tests (http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#load-tests-protocol). This would be a much more reliable way to ensure order'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-19 07:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Unless there are very good reasons for not doing so I think we want to ensure that all tests are idempotent and independent (eg use of unique names where needed). This makes optimising use of resources and parallelisation a much easier job. 

If some tests currently do need to be run in a certain order then perhaps they should be wrapped in a single testcase?'}, {'account_id': 864, 'date': '2013-02-26 12:37:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Abandoned

I've modified so that the tests can run in any order. The update resulted in a new change set : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22978"}]

commit_message:
Add tests which verify quota behaviour

    Adds a new file containing 3 tests which perform a simple
    quota check for each of network, subnet, and port. Each test loops
    creating a [network,subnet,port] until either the max permitted number
    of iterations is reached, or a quota exceeded exception is hit.
    For the test to pass, the quota exceeded exception must be hit.
    Modified tempest.conf.sample to enable larger subnets which permit

    Implements: blueprint quantum-quota-basic-tests quota tests
    Change-Id: Ia13e4360ff474ef9db21698b17a933ab3cccd735

Change-Id: Idd58fb766f186e5e8f7c6a8aa5be7e9a3f8e1c62

gongysh - Thanks - good catches, fix coming

markmclain - In general, this is part of the work to get things moved from serial nose execution to parallel execution like we did in nova and elsewhere. Step one in that is getting the tests cleaned up so that we can do the parallel work, and most of the engineering work we've done in that area during this cycle has been around testtools. testtools also has really good docs:

https://testtools.readthedocs.org/en/latest/for-test-authors.html

I hear you on the self.assertRaises thing - it would have been really great if the python stdlib folks hadn't plopped in a new core API that was incompatible with several of the testing libs out there (I believe it's a problem for trial as well)"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

Hi monty, I think the team agrees on the goal of getting toward parallel unit tests... especially the way quantum runs each unit test for each of an increasing number of plugins.  

My only question is only around timing + disruption to existing patches in flight.  Making the entire switch at this point in the release, when we have a lot of patches in flight that would need to be rebased, will cause a lot of disruption.  If we're about to hit a break wall in terms of CI infrastructure during Grizzly, this may make sense as an urgent change.  If not, I would guess that it is better to do this once Havana opens.  Or is the goal to get it in before grizzly for grizzly stable CI?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Ok, I'm fine with this moving forward.  If we can get to parallel testing for grizzly, that would be a huge win.  If this is just infrastructure for parallel testing that won't actually be achieved until Havana, its a bit complex, as there are probably other patches in flight with the old usage and would need each of those to update."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (3 inline comments)

a few minor comments and one question.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

OK, are there any outstanding concerns on this patch-set?  Given the scope of the changes, I'd like to get this merged sooner rather than later."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21350/22/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5080 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/21350/22/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/10162 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

just rebased. The cause of conflict was just import order changes.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Monty
Could you add corresponding bp for quantum project also?'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

+1 for importing hacking.py (in other patch)'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

dan: Besides the parallel test usage, the switch from tearDown to addCleanup in the subsequent patch catches a few cleanup misses that have been latent and ensures locality of cleanup to the fixture setup to avoid this problem in the future.  I vote for this going in sooner than later, especially given that merge conflicts should be mostly limited to setup/teardown changes of test modules.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Some minor stuff inline, but a good first pass overall."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Thank you for the import ordering cleanup.   One file was missed, but other than that things look good.

As an aside, I was heartened to see that automatic verification is now being done for some of the HACKING dictates.  Hopefully import ordering is on the todo list?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: (1 inline comment)

My chief concern is that we're moving away from standard unit test methods from the stdlib.  There is lots of python documentation available for how to use the unittest and unittest2 features and moving to a non standard tool makes it harder for new contributors."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

why is test_setup.py removed?'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

thanks for the new updates. I have one comment which is not replied to yet.

commit_message:
Use testtools instead of unittest or unittest2.

As part of the move towards testr and parallel test running, we
start to use testtools and fixtures to make the test suite
resilient and more pedantic.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I90250de9fe21237db34f6a50b89b15863e270aa5

Add glossary definitions for additional terms

Add glossary definitions for the following: meter, project, resource, sample, source, user.

Fixes bug 1070382

Change-Id: I56120cafcdb6faa160724e7774c6e54a25e1bf43

commit_message:
if reset fails, display the command that failed

we get failures in _reset_databases from time to time, and it's
hard to debug without understanding what command failed. Make
this show up in the assert message.

Now with even more output!

Change-Id: Ie82109cfb1745e7218e0906764db1fad0c8fc5f5

commit_message:
Set default api_extensions_path for NEC plugin

NEC plugin has a plugin specific extension in its plugin directory.
api_extension_path must be set in quantum.conf to enable quantum-server
to load the extension, but users sometimes forget to set it. It provides
better usability if api_extensions_path is set appropriately by default.

Fixes bug 1133099

Change-Id: Ifa6d8a4f6bd30be5c6641c127ffcfaab5ff20b47

[{'created': '2013-02-26 07:25:53.000000000', 'message': 'Enables packetfilter ext in NEC plugin based on its driver config

packet filter extension in NEC plugin should be determined based on
a return value of filter_supported method in the backend driver.
Previously filter_supported was not called actually and packetfilter
extension was always enabled.

Fixes bug #1133100

Change-Id: I1334c7695e64bc942c0ecce2bd85e5a92e75b388
'}]
commit_message:
Enables packetfilter ext in NEC plugin based on its driver config

packet filter extension in NEC plugin should be determined based on
a return value of filter_supported method in the backend driver.
Previously filter_supported was not called actually and packetfilter
extension was always enabled.

Fixes bug #1133100

Change-Id: I1334c7695e64bc942c0ecce2bd85e5a92e75b388

The implementation decision that still needs to be made for using this in Tempest is how to detect the distro of the image. For Rackspace images this is straightforward since the distro is part of the image metadata. There had been talk of common image metadata fields, but I'm not sure that effort moved forward. Worst case, the distro would have to be set at config time."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-22 06:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

By distro do you mean just which linux distribution? If so the lsb_release is probably on most. But I'm curious as to why we need to know it?"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-22 07:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Unfortunately the wmi module is not working on Linux (is client). 

Python 2.7.3 (default, Jul 24 2012, 10:05:38) 
[GCC 4.7.0 20120507 (Red Hat 4.7.0-5)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import wmi
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/wmi.py", line 88, in <module>
    from win32com.client import GetObject, Dispatch
ImportError: No module named win32com.client


sudo pip-python install win32com
Downloading/unpacking win32com
  Could not find any downloads that satisfy the requirement win32com
No distributions at all found for win32com
Storing complete log in /root/.pip/pip.log

Do you know about any platform independent WMI client ?

Can we use SNMP ?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:36:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

You're right that the WMI libraries don't work on Linux. We run all our tests for Windows images from Windows servers. We had picked WMI because it was a solid programatic approach for accessing data on Windows servers, but I can revist SNMP to see if there's native python libraries for Linux and it provides the needed functionality.

The reason we need to know the distro is because certain distros output data in slightly different ways (the datetime format returned for last boot time on Gentoo and Arch differs from the rest of the pack) and because there's things like FreeBSD which act like Linux in many ways, but have some specific ways to access system info."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 16:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can we start with pep8 fixes, then figure out how to deal with the whole windows thing."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 16:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I pushed the pep8 fixes last night but the job didn't run again for some reason. Let me try it again"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 16:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 17:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just an additional FYI, we've also vetted remote powershell as a solution since it's a fairly close equivalent to SSH in the Windows world, but it also has the same drawback of being Windows only. We had to get this coverage in and we've been using WMI successfully for awhile now, but if a Linux compatible solution exists, I'm all ears."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 17:39:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22664/3/check/gate-tempest-pep8/2268 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22664/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/5067 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22664/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/4786 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22664/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/9665 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22664/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/504 : FAILURE (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 20:10:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

doesn't look like the code actually works with tempest, would be good to get it fixed."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 21:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-22 21:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry, I didn't realize that I needed to remark the branch each time I resubmitted the branch. The goal of submitting this was:

1) Determine if there was interest outside Rack in instance validation of Windows images
2) See if there were any objections to the methodology"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-23 20:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I already mentioned the SNMP. It is working on Windows.
There are many ssh installation possibilities on Windows. For example cyngwin, provides the usually Unix utilities too.

There are many third party agents, which provides these information too.

(FYI: There are some WQL implementation for Linux (Probably not just for Linux), look around these projects: openvas, Samba, Zenoss. Probably will not be easy to make them working in tempest)

We do not need a package for every single module!
(We usually do not need a new module for a small class.)

We will need a configuration option, which selects the guest client class.

The methods implemented now in Linux Client, will not be enough forever, we will need a facility for doing alamost arbitrary things...

I am not sure, we will be able to manage extend these classes for all OS at the same time. 

Probably using cyngwin on Windows makes these things the most easiest.

ssh connection with PowerShell (default shell) is enough easy too. 

You could reach the console output (Serial Port).

The methods you implemented, coverable by SNMP instead of WMI.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-24 20:41:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, there are many SSH options for Windows, but that involves modifying a stock image. The goal is to be able to test a stock Windows image. I'm also puzzled about the resistance to proper packaging. However, if as you say you already have a working SNMP solution in place, I'll leave that someone to submit. I'll abandon this branch."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-25 09:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

AFAIK the openstack does not know about the guest system OS type. Do we reach any additionally coverage in any openstack component, if we test with multiple guest OS ?

FIXME: Only the filesystem type, has a minimal affect to openstack.
- Personality (It is even not fully tested with linux)
- Image expansion (Many combination not tested).

Is there anything else worth to inspect ?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Addresses lp#1131528 - Adds Windows/FreeBSD instance clients

* Create instance client interface facade
* Seperate Linux client into own namespace
* Add Windows client with equivalent commands
* Added FreeBSD client to handle Linux/BSD differences

Change-Id: I1093ffb11dc246d52194df6d3fdd81c78baeac8d

[{'created': '2013-02-19 06:10:06.000000000', 'message': "Adding speed limit options for DB auditor

Fix bug 1129760

Without speed limit, DB auditor will likely consume high CPU% on
storage node. That will highly impact the cluster's performance.

This patch adds two options for account/container auditor:
 - containers_per_second
 - accounts_per_second

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9faa506438185a83ca77db4906969328624d015f

commit_message:
Adding speed limit options for DB auditor

Fix bug 1129760

Without speed limit, DB auditor will likely consume high CPU% on
storage node. That will highly impact the cluster's performance.

This patch adds two options for account/container auditor:
 - containers_per_second: Maximum containers audited per second
 - accounts_per_second: Maximum accounts audited per second

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9faa506438185a83ca77db4906969328624d015f

commit_message:
Fix hacking.py to handle 'cannot import x'

Fix missingImport logic to handle a module that cannot be imported, due
to a missing dependant module.

Due to the nature of this bug doctests cannot cover it.

Fix bug 1133103

Change-Id: Ia067bacc125b67e2d9e0cfc72495e4f13a8648ad

subject: Don't delete a port that's in use Fixes: bug #1119409
messages:
[{'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This might be a dumb opinion, but with the changes for hotplug coming up in nova, perhaps deleting a port associated with a VM might be ok.

Keeping that in mind, raising a portinuse looks acceptable, but not ideal solution.
There's really no control on the device_id and device_owner fields so far - so it's something one can relay upon."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

ah, my original thinking was correct.  This generates an exception, its just a side-affect of this patch not working correctly with the plugin that I was using that made it harder to detect the issue."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

was this tested with nova?  Unless i'm missing something, this will prevent nova from deleting ports when a VM is deleted."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

huh... my testing says that this is ok, but I would have expected the opposite based on the code.  I need to look at this more closely.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

i think i already mentioned this on the bug, but i'd prefer to keep the api clean, and add checks or force options to the clients themselves."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think that this will prevent nova compute from deleting quantum ports. This is what nova does when it terminates  a VM. This is problematic."}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hm... I've completely missed the fact that nova can delete VMs and remove the port that's in use by the VM :)

Could we rearrange workflow so that nova would:
- delete VM
- free/unassign port/IP
- delete port/IP

Second step would just update the row, allowing the IP to be deleted.

Another option would be to 'force' delete the port, when request comes from nova. I'm just not sure how we could distinguish nova from other clients."}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-04 17:10:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix metadata updates and deletes.

The 'metadata' reference on the Instance model is a list-like
collection, not a dict.  The unit tests and code were erroneously
treat it as a dict.

Also the instance update notification on delete
falsely showed no metadata.

bug 1115385

Change-Id: Ib94f81b8eabe3985d293bdcea8acbc3d0a37ac12
"}, {'created': '2013-02-04 19:54:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata in instance update notification.

Fix the instance metadata sent in the instance update notification
after deleting a metadata key.

Change-Id: Ib94f81b8eabe3985d293bdcea8acbc3d0a37ac12
'}, {'created': '2013-02-15 16:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata in instance update notification.

Fix the instance metadata sent in the instance update notification
after deleting a metadata key.

Change-Id: Ib94f81b8eabe3985d293bdcea8acbc3d0a37ac12
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata in instance update notification.

Fix the instance metadata sent in the instance update notification
after deleting a metadata key.

Change-Id: Ib94f81b8eabe3985d293bdcea8acbc3d0a37ac12

'}]
commit_message:
Fix ramdisk-image-create

ELEMENTS_DIR env var was not being set by lib/ramdisk-defaults.
This caused ramdisk-image-create to fail.

Change-Id: I25ec43feddb8ef546dba83a77b8488fee98d4a17

commit_message:
Refactor data migration tests

This commit adds a more general framework for testing data
transitions at any db migration. Based on the test migration
framework in nova.

This commit also updates the existing individual migration
tests to use the new framework.

Change-Id: I917cfefe266a98f6c63613ac071af2dd676d67a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 19:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration 016 for sqlite.

This commit fixes 2 issues with sqlite on migration 016. Firstly, the
definition of the column differed slightly from it's definition in the
images table. The length was set to 20 in image_members, however the
status column in the images table has a length of 30.

Secondly, sqlite doesn't support dropping a column from a table. The
downgrade path for migration 016 performed this. So this commit adds the
sql file to perform the downgrade manually.

Change-Id: I6aae263c3aab03a383c47fd29c46f0cc9b857549
"}, {'created': '2013-02-22 20:51:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration 016 for sqlite.

Sqlite doesn't support dropping a column from a table. The
downgrade path for migration 016 performed this. So this commit adds the
sql file to perform the downgrade manually.

Change-Id: I6aae263c3aab03a383c47fd29c46f0cc9b857549
"}, {'created': '2013-02-25 21:13:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration 016 for sqlite.

Sqlite doesn't support dropping a column from a table. The
downgrade path for migration 016 performed this. So this commit adds the
sql file to perform the downgrade manually.

Change-Id: I6aae263c3aab03a383c47fd29c46f0cc9b857549
"}]
commit_message:
Fix migration 016 for sqlite.

Sqlite doesn't support dropping a column from a table. The
downgrade path for migration 016 performed this. So this commit adds the
sql file to perform the downgrade manually.

Change-Id: I6aae263c3aab03a383c47fd29c46f0cc9b857549

hi salv, I figured it would be easier to just make my comments directly on the patchset than try to explain then.  I made changes for L3 + metadata support.  Also cleaned up some tab issues.  

Still haven't done anything around supporting stand-alone DHCP on a node that his not a HV... i suspect that may be broken for all q-plugins at this point."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks for fixing this patch!'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (2 inline comments)

Hi Dan, I think there might be a case for splitting the changes into lib/quantum into a distinct patch. What do you reckon?

I agree the issue with br-int on the dhcp host is probably not nicira specific. Usually the dhcp-agent is run together with l3-agent and q-agent, which triggers the creation of br-int.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

As far as splitting, i'm fine either way.  I didn't want to make too many patches for the devstack folks to review, and the changes don't really make sense outside of having the NVP plugin.  I guess we could merge the main NVP change set, then have a different one that refactors L3 + adds NVP support for L3.  I have the changes locally, so feel free to remove them from this patchset."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-23 19:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-23 21:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-23 21:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

ok, i updated the patch to address my last comment. 

I switch us to say that we are an OVS plugin, so that nova would correctly change the cgroup_acl value in the qemu.conf

I also updated some more logic in lib/quantum, to appropriately scope some logic to only run when q-l3 agent was enabled.  

I also replaced some config values in the dhcp section required for metadata that I think you had accidentally removed in a previous patchset.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-23 22:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
Devstack support for nicira plugin

Bug 1116847

Includes slight refactoring of L3 logic in main lib/quantum as previous
logic treated l3-agent as only way to do L3, whereas NVP has its own L3
support.

Change-Id: Ifd8c6864add5939432b544285cf027e52329dea2

That makes this approach somewhat less elegant than what shardy and I were thinking.

commit_message:
Update the metadata if an alarm action makes changes

The point of this change?
- You have another instances' ip in your metadata and if it
  gets restarted you want cfn-hup to see the new ip.

How is it achieved?
- poll for the metadata so you can see these changes (cfn-hup)
- when ever an alarm action is run we make sure the metadata is refreshed.

bug #1131024
Change-Id: I0798c4da9689b126c3c98cafa63138ff2c484ea9

commit_message:
Make host_power_action work in cells

 * Adds code and tests to make sure host_power_action gets transmitted
   through to cells and the result returned
 * Adds support to call host_api methods in cells

Fixes: bug #1130997
Change-Id: I1e9397b1bd230cb300d7fd5c590ded7b2e2c5cfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-25 20:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up error reporting one middleware errors.

If the body is not valid JSON, we were getting a 500 error. This catches and
reports a more appropriate error.

Change-Id: Ic241340613a56f3e54b35181770106ea5872afd3
'}, {'created': '2013-02-25 22:46:39.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up error reporting on middleware errors.

The body gets parsed to JSON. But then the JSON gets converted to a dictionary.
If the  JSON has a list at the top level, the dictionary conversion fails.
This was causing a 500 error. This catches it and
reports a more appropriate error.

Change-Id: Ic241340613a56f3e54b35181770106ea5872afd3
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up error reporting on middleware errors.

The body gets parsed to JSON. But then the JSON gets converted to a dictionary.
If the  JSON has a list at the top level, the dictionary conversion fails.
This was causing a 500 error. This catches it and
reports a more appropriate error.

Change-Id: Ic241340613a56f3e54b35181770106ea5872afd3

How to conduct XML Validation on WADL files

1. visit "http://www.utilities-online.info/xsdvalidation/"
2. copy and paste the source of "http://www.w3.org/Submission/wadl/wadl.xsd" to the XSD Schema section
3. copy and paste a WADL file from quantum/doc/wadl to the XML section
4. Edit "%SERVICE_HOST%:%SERVICE_PORT%" to "localhost:9696" on line 3. (This will automatically be swapped to the values in quantum.conf in the integration tests scripts in the future)
5. Hit button'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

The whole point of a WADL is to allow generating stubs with 3rd party tools.
Are we saying instead that we want to provide our own tool?'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

I can confirm the parser works.

However, I am still not clear on how the parsed data are supposed to be used.

Parsing core.wadl, for instance, I get an application with resources (subnets, networks, and ports) - but, at least in the ruby parser, they seem to be empty, meaning that I can't find any of the methods 

Can I get some information on how to import the WADL and use the generated application? 

As stated in the blueprint the goal is to generated stubs for client apps. So we should confirm this is possible, albeit in a reduced way, before merging.

I also have tried, with no luck, python's wadllib. But that project is probably outdated now. If you are using a parser different than ruby's blakcwinter, tell me what to use.

a README with all these information would be welcome.

My current position is that this work will definitely be of great use, but we shouldn't feel in a rush to merge it for G-3.
Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Do not merge

-2 to prevent accidental merging prior to grizzly branching'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me.
Not familiar that familiar so I do not feel comfortable to give a +2 at the moment'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I'll write a XSLT sample script and put it up on README or maybe in a separate file in quantum/tool/wadl"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Changes from patchset 14:

Removed Exception()s and added ValueTypeNotFound error
Rewrite of representation comments.
TODO for multiple return codes for GET, PUT, and POST'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The schema work can be another patch, so I'm OK for remaining some todos in the code now. ( I wanna just know why it keeping todos )"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (10 inline comments)

Awesome work!

Anne Gentle is working on cool doc generation from wadl http://api.openstack.org/api-ref.html 
I think it is great if we can have quantum version of it.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

added Anne as a reviewer'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Zhongyue 
we should use atom instead of xml schema, because nova using atom.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Oh, I didn't know that. if so, It sounds we should use XML schema."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (4 inline comments)

I have some comment, but all of it is not blocker'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for your work on this'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

python wadllib is outdated and it only works with launchpad api.
I didn't tried ruby's one, but basically interpreting all spec of WADL is little bit hard so may be the ruby lib didn't support full spec.

For the code generation, we can write XSLT script. This way should work."}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-02-26 02:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Abandoned

I'll restore this in the H1 cycle"}]

Quantum API WADL doc generation

Implements blueprint quantum-api-wadl

Generated WADL file for core API and some API extensions

Change-Id: I65f65803574e822ef22fcfb51c50fd6f9d1913ad
