- http://logs.openstack.org/18042/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/22178 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18042/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/4314 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-13 15:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:11:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

None of this stuff should be done in the libvirt/config.py file. That file is solely concerned for providing the object model & XML serialization. It has no business applying policy decisions like this. That should be done in the driver.py file or other relevant places which actually construct the LibvirtConfigGuestDisk object instances."}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Added comments/question in line.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-13 17:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Agree with his Libvirt Highness on the other issue as well, of course.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-12-13 17:26:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There have been a handful of submissions recent around manipulating various aspects of libvirt XML.  It's becoming quite clear that we need a generic, flexible model for accomplishing this, rather than incrementally introducing a complex decision tree of IF/ELSEs in that section of the code.

Almost all the use cases which have come in are completely valid (as is this case here, I don't always want writethrough either) but we're going to make a mess of the code unless we tackle this as a broader effort."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-12-13 17:40:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> There have been a handful of submissions recent around manipulating
> various aspects of libvirt XML. It's becoming quite clear that we
> need a generic, flexible model for accomplishing this, rather than
> incrementally introducing a complex decision tree of IF/ELSEs in
> that section of the code.

I disagree with the idea of a generic facility for letting users change arbitrary parts of the configuration. Different aspects of the configuration can have an impact on overall operation of the VM/driver. For example, changing the disk cache mode to certain values will prevent the use of migration, and require Nova to take special steps to make migration work.  For this reason it is key that Nova have full knowledge & control over the disk cache mode in use, and not have it arbitrarily changed by the user via some generic XML config override mechanism.

At the same time though, I'm not saying we should have config parameters in Nova for every aspect of XML configuration. I would much rather we made Nova more intelligent at creating the correct configuration, than push that burden onto the administrator.

For this particular case, I'd prefer to see some more concrete information about the reasons for needing to the change the disk cache mode. If we understand the motivation for this, we may well be able to come up with a much better idea than just exposing a config parameter to directly set cache mode."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2012-12-14 11:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think there are a number of different points getting mixed up in this review which need to be separated out for clarity:

1) Should Nova provide intelligent default settings ?

Yes, we want a great out of the box default experience.  But the change proposed here doesn't affect the Nova's ability to provide an intelligent default correct configuration - it's an override option that can be used by people who need to have more control over the libvirt configuration used for instances.   


2) Should Nova allow "expert" configuration options for those that need them and are willing to work through the consequences:

Yes, it would be verging on arrogant madness to assume that only the Nova code knows the "right" way to configure something as complex as livbirt in every case.  I wouldn't categorise this change as being about allowing users making changes to arbitrary parts of the configuration – it’s about providing sufficient flexibility to enable knowledgeable administrators to provide an override to the default behaviour.   There was a very good session at the Design Summit on the need to simplify the default configuration for "out of the box" users whilst still providing "expert" options for those that need them and have the knowledge to use them appropriately.   I still strongly support getting that clarity in the config mechanism, but until we have it we shouldn't block other changes on the basis that the "codebase knows best" - it clearly can't cover everyone’s use cases from a single set of built-in settings.


3) Is config.py the right place to do this ?

Well from the name of the file it sounds like exactly the best place to do it ;-)      I think the trouble here is that this is a configuration option which needs to affect settings that originate in both driver and volume, and I thought it was intended that they should be independent.   If it’s thought better to have the processing of the config option in driver and have volume call that method then that would be an alternative.      Adding a more general configuration module ( does_config_but_isnt_called_config,py ?) seems like a bit of a leap until we have more cases to understand exactly what’s required – maybe a blueprint at the next summit would be the best place for that.   At one time we had such a beast in the template file, but that was refactored in favour of direct XML generation, so I'm wary of just spinning here.   

Either way 3) seems to me to be the only issue that should be focused on in reviewing this specific change.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-12-17 09:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would still like to know what criteria you have for changing the cache mode. What scenarios are you facing which make alternative cache modes a better choice.  If you are facing them, then it is quite possible that other users of Nova will face them too, so it is in everyone's interested to get a clear description of this. Only then can we figure out whether this requires an "expert" option, or whether Nova can provide a more satisfactory default.  Currently you're effectively just asking reviewers to accept that you know best without giving any information to backup your assertion that this can only be done with "expert" options.

If a config option is relevant to multiple parts of the libvirt code then it should be in driver.py, since that is what is ultimately in charge of everything. The other modules can either reference that config option, or the driver.py can pass parameters into methods of other classes it uses.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2012-12-19 11:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Daniel,

Thanks for the steer on driver.py, we’ll work on a refactor to make the change there instead.

I’m not trying to be obtuse on the use case – I’ve had a number of different requests around this from various parts of HP some of whom are working on specific hardware configurations and some of whom what to  be able to provide different ranges of performance / SLA.  None of them sound like the kind of logic that it would make sense to embed in Nova, and not of them make me think that the current defaults should be changed.    

I do agree with you that we may need a more general configuration approach now that we don’t have the template file anymore, but I haven’t come across sufficient data points yet to really characterise what the scope of that  needs to be.    Maybe we should have a separate thread around this.

Cheers,
Phil'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-12-19 11:44:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, thanks for explaining your background further. I guess we have no choice but to go with a disk cache config option for now then. One thing that I'm wondering is whether your proposed config option choices offer sufficient granularity. In particular I'm thinking of the 'file' type, which may apply to either local or network filesystems. I fear that people might want to have different cache settings for a local fs (ext3) vs a network (NFS/GFS/etc). Perhaps we can leave that as a future enhancement if people so wish"}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2012-12-20 12:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2012-12-20 12:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Made changes to driver.py as discussed.'}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2012-12-20 13:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2012-12-20 13:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Missed some pep8 warnings.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-20 13:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-17 12:55:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

3 Things

#1 - this needs a DocImpact flag, as it would change opts.

#2 - Definitely needs more documentation about the available options that one might use here in the option help. If we are exposing a knob, we need to explain more about why folks would use it.

#3 - I feel like having a list opt is somewhat error prone. In your usage is it all types that got overrides, or typically only one? Would it make sense to have a separate option per type?"}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2013-01-21 12:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-01-21 12:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1882, 'date': '2013-01-21 12:49:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Published patch 6 in response to Sean's comments.

#1 - Agreed I've added the flag to the commit message

#3 - Only the types included in the list will have their mode impacted all others will follow the default behaviour. revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-13 15:11:15.000000000', 'message': 'Adding ability to specify the libvirt cache mode for disk devices

In past versions of Nova it was possible to explicitly configure
the cache mode of disks via the libvirt XML template. The curent approach
makes this a derived setting of either “none” or “writethrough” based
on the support of O_DIRECT. Whilst this provides a good set of default
settings it removes the ability of the cloud provider to use other
modes such as “writeback” and “unsafe” which are valuable in certain
configurations.

This change allows the cache mode to be specified on a per-disk type
basis. Leaving the specify_cachemode option set to False retains the
current behaviour.

bug 1086386

Change-Id: I3d296fe0b4b9b976db02db90ad69fd299cd2096a

commit_message:
Adding ability to specify the libvirt cache mode for disk devices

In past versions of Nova it was possible to explicitly configure
the cache mode of disks via the libvirt XML template. The current approach
makes this a derived setting of either “none” or “writethrough” based
on the support of O_DIRECT. Whilst this provides a good set of default
settings it removes the ability of the cloud provider to use other
modes such as “writeback” and “unsafe” which are valuable in certain
configurations.

This change allows the cache mode to be specified on a per-disk type
basis. If a disk type does not have a cache mode specified then the
default behaviour remains unchanged.

DocImpact

bug 1086386

Change-Id: I3d296fe0b4b9b976db02db90ad69fd299cd2096a

commit_message:
Updates to OSAPI sizelimit middleware.

Updates the OSAPI sizelimit middleware so that we use avoid calling
len on a request body which could cause a really large request
to get buffered into memory.

Also updates the middleware to return HTTP 413 which is a more
correct error code in this case (previously it returned just 400).

Fixes LP Bug #1131857.

Change-Id: Id8bc5eeb0fba9482809edd12543a75163e1227e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 19:35:50.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: lxml behavior breaks version check.

lxml doesn't roundtrip empty strings, meaning if you serialize
and element with value '', when you derserialize it, the value will be
`None`.

This broke the version_string_with_package check because None and ''
will not compare as equivalent.

The solution is to coerce the None value back to an empty string before
running the check.

Change-Id: Ia3a8ae68f12a4645057d243fdee59197df40e8d3
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: lxml behavior breaks version check.

lxml doesn't roundtrip empty strings, meaning if you serialize
and element with value '', when you derserialize it, the value will be
`None`.

This broke the version_string_with_package check because None and ''
will not compare as equivalent.

The solution is to coerce the None value back to an empty string before
running the check.

Change-Id: Ia3a8ae68f12a4645057d243fdee59197df40e8d3

commit_message:
Ensure macs can be serialized.

This patch uses to_primitive() to ensure that the macs argument to the
rpcapi method allocate_for_instance() can be serialized by rpc drivers.
Specifically, the powervm driver uses a set() here, and that will cause
breakage in non-kombu drivers.

Fix bug 1131035.

Change-Id: I5729c5854799e49c6598e4dd2a4da487598307f1

commit_message:
Prevent default security group deletion.

This patch adds a check to confirm that a security group name
is not among a list of 'special' group names before proceeding
with security group deletion.

Fixes: bug 1131830

Change-Id: I5656e01b4ed3fd9c22abe6a731edaef7203d97c4

Handle XML body of server's virtual interfaces correctly.

In addition, fix the test to check the json in a right way, and
add test that validates the virtual interfaces' mac address

Make the server action type calls use the same common function,

commit_message:
Small server action code compression

Make the server action type calls use the same common function,
instead of a code duplication.
It is just the beginning of making the tempest.service more compact.

This patch also removes the duplicated not used methods from the json
client:
* confirm_migration (confirmResize)
* start_server (os-start)
* stop_server (os-stop)

Change-Id: Ic036354c93b837d455f9478dc6dac249ec674ae7

commit_message:
Allow password_autocomplete to be set through local_settings.py

Make it easier to implement changes to the password_autocomplete setting by implementing it into settings.py and therefore allowing an override in local_settings.py

Change-Id: I25c49561bc2e155ae6b119b4b6dbb1131c4f7bd9
Fixes: bug #1124109

commit_message:
Add service_name to service_catalog.url_for.

Updates the service_catalog url_for helper method so that
it supports an extra 'service_name' option. This should
allow service catalog URL's to be selected with a bit more
detail.

Fixes LP Bug #1122156.

Change-Id: Ie879d8462e4a578bcd38a3e2113d6187e6b07664

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary qemu-img dependency on powervm driver

Fixes bug 1131033

Power VM driver is using qemu-img through the fetch_to_raw call
No need to attempt a conversion since power images can only
be represented with the raw format, removing thus the need for
any conversions by calling fetch instead of fetch_to_raw.

Change-Id: I94b46e184cb87924a4754a0a48d9c2013a3eb756

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 20:35:45.000000000', 'message': "Make guestfs use same libvirt URI as Nova.

Updates our libguestfs vfs implementation so that it makes use of
the same libvirt connection URI as Nova does when using
attach mode 'libvirt'. Previously when libguestfs used attach
mode 'libvirt' (the default on some newer distros like Fedora 18)
you could get permissions issues and ultimately get a libvirt
connection error from libguestfs:

  could not connect to libvirt (URI = NULL)

Having libguestfs use the same connection URL as Nova makes sense
and gets past these permission issues. (avoiding things like forcing
you to create a $HOME dir for the nova user among other things)

Full thread on this is here:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=913345

Note that on most distros the default libguestfs attach method
is still 'appliance' so this would have no affect unless explicitly
enabled via LIBGUESTFS_ATTACH_METHOD.

Change-Id: I7e9f010022731a43e8d793cf8415ec12b346fdb4
"}, {'created': '2013-02-22 14:55:13.000000000', 'message': "Make guestfs use same libvirt URI as Nova.

Updates our libguestfs vfs implementation so that it makes use of
the same libvirt connection URI as Nova does when using
attach mode 'libvirt'. Previously when libguestfs used attach
mode 'libvirt' (the default on some newer distros like Fedora 18)
you could get permissions issues and ultimately get a libvirt
connection error from libguestfs:

  could not connect to libvirt (URI = NULL)

Docs on guestfs attach method can be found here:

  http://libguestfs.org/guestfs.3.html#attach-method

Having libguestfs use the same connection URL as Nova makes sense
and gets past these permission issues. (avoiding things like forcing
you to create a $HOME dir for the nova user among other things)

Full thread on this is here:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=913345

Note that on most distros the default libguestfs attach method
is still 'appliance' so this would have no affect unless explicitly
enabled via LIBGUESTFS_ATTACH_METHOD.

Fixes LP Bug #1131768.

Change-Id: I7e9f010022731a43e8d793cf8415ec12b346fdb4
"}]
commit_message:
Make guestfs use same libvirt URI as Nova.

Updates our libguestfs vfs implementation so that it makes use of
the same libvirt connection URI as Nova does when using
attach mode 'libvirt'. Previously when libguestfs used attach
mode 'libvirt' (the default on some newer distros like Fedora 18)
you could get permissions issues and ultimately get a libvirt
connection error from libguestfs:

  could not connect to libvirt (URI = NULL)

Docs on guestfs attach method can be found here:

  http://libguestfs.org/guestfs.3.html#attach-method

Having libguestfs use the same connection URL as Nova makes sense
and gets past these permission issues. (avoiding things like forcing
you to create a $HOME dir for the nova user among other things)

Full thread on this is here:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=913345

Note that on most distros the default libguestfs attach method
is still 'appliance' so this would have no affect unless explicitly
enabled via LIBGUESTFS_ATTACH_METHOD.

Fixes LP Bug #1131768.

Change-Id: I7e9f010022731a43e8d793cf8415ec12b346fdb4

commit_message:
Make LibvirtDriver.uri() a staticmethod.

LibvirtDriver's uri() function seems to be the most logical place
where one can access the libvirt URL used by Nova. I would like
access to this outside the scope of the internal libvirt
driver (for libguestfs) so exposing it as a static
resource seems to make sense.

Partial fix for LP Bug #1131768.

Change-Id: I653296414716b4e799d68f6bfc868e6039d6ea4a

commit_message:
Drop unused columns from baremetal db

Drop these two columns:
* bm_nodes.prov_vlan_id
* bm_nodes.registration_status

And update related code, tests and api_samples.

Change-Id: Iadefc83a00ad9ae5a3bb39f357080299875bdfd9

I recommend that it be moved up to nova.virt.driver and existing code (libvirt, vmwareapi, etc) get refactored to use it."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-19 13:35:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The right solution is to move the option up in scope, also please don't add lots of whitespace to copyright lines."}, {'account_id': 5149, 'date': '2013-02-21 04:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

base_dir_name is moved from nova/compute/manager to nova/virt/libvirt/imagecache in commit https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/33d7f56cc424071a90f78ebd21913ce2bc9e6c0d
"Move imagecache code from nova.virt.libvirt.utils
The imagecache related code in libvirt.utils uses the base_dir_name
config option.

If we move the imagecache utils into imagecache, then we can move
the base_dir_name option into that module since there are no other
users of it."

Frankly I don't think it was a good idea as base_dir_name is still documented as a nova.conf configuration option at http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/list-of-compute-config-options.html

I wonder if Mark could help out here but moving it up again.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-02-21 11:09:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 5149, 'date': '2013-02-21 18:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Mark, thank you for the suggestion. I am stuck somewhere on I80, but I was able to find a wifi spot and published a review at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22577/'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-22 18:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This needs to be abandoned as the other fix went in.'}, {'account_id': 6498, 'date': '2013-02-23 02:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Fixed this through https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22577/'}]

commit_message:
vCenter nova compute service fails

vCenter nova compute service fails to start because
base_dir_name config not registered but used by vmops.py

Fixes Bug 1126078

Change-Id: I76807ce4ed7be8138140f770c30eeb7c4a2e79c1

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary logging from migration 019

Migration 019 included debug logging for every sqlalchemy call
that was run. This commit removes all of the logging and makes it
consistent with the other migrations.

Change-Id: I914f4f4458eacbb3bcabac092bbe166ce9069a5f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 19:19:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix migration 015 downgrade with sqlite.

This adds a list() call around the select sqlalchemy to pull
the list of locations that start with swift. The list() call
forces the select query to finish, before we try to update the
database.

Change-Id: I63f2e184a49e8bbd7115dd59d644506ea4069558
'}]
commit_message:
Fix migration 015 downgrade with sqlite.

This adds a list() call around the select sqlalchemy to pull
the list of locations that start with swift. The list() call
forces the select query to finish, before we try to update the
database.

Change-Id: I63f2e184a49e8bbd7115dd59d644506ea4069558

commit_message:
Don't set filter name if we use Noop driver

If we are using the Noop firewall driver we don't set a filter name.

Fixes: bug #1131358
Change-Id: I5e8a92baa6838ed51b55ffd6af1e98da6dd662c2

commit_message:
Adds first-byte latency timings for GET requests.

This was an oustanding TODO for StatsD Swift metrics.  A new timing
metric is tracked for (only) GET requests for accounts, containers,
and objects:

  proxy-server.<req_type>.GET.<status_int>.first-byte.timing

Also updated StatsD documentation in the Admin Guide to clarify that
timing metrics are sent in units of milliseconds.

Change-Id: I5bb781c06cefcb5280f4fb1112a526c029fe0c20

Actually, I'm not sure there's any value here if we don't treat the existing images. We now use a uniform-length image identifier, so Glance should not ever cause this issue again. The possibility is still there for a user to cause havoc by adding an object prefixed with an image ID, but I'm not sure we need to protect ourselves from something like that. What problem do you actually see being solved here?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-18 17:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hm, in that case there may or may not be value in this change. It depends on what the expectations are around the glance-images container.

Imagine that I show up and say "hey, I put my notes about glance-images/$imageid into glance-images/$imageid.txt and now my downloads of $imageid are messed up." If you then tell me that glance-images is for Glance only and to get my grubby hands out of it, then this changeset is of zero value. However, if that's a situation that the Glance devs believe should not break things, then this changeset will help with that.

I'm not familiar enough with Glance to know the answer to the above question, so I'll leave it to the discretion of those who do.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:20:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

So I am of the belief that the Glance container should be 'hands off' to the world - it is wholly-owned by Glance. However, I do think we could help prevent conflict in a case similar to what you suggest. This change appears pretty low-risk and will help (not completely stop) conflict in the case that someone is mucking around in a conatiner, so I'm in favor of it."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Reading through the X-Object-Manifest spec, this change seems to be exactly the correct behavior.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-05 01:43:23.000000000', 'message': 'Use more-specific value for X-Object-Manifest header.

When uploading a large image to Swift, the segments are named
glance/<imageid>-<segmentnumber>. However, the value of
X-Object-Manifest is only glance/<imageid> without the trailing
dash. This can lead to odd behavior when there are other objects that
start with <imageid>, but are not actually segments of the image.

For example, in bug 1112653, a user was using python-swiftclient to
delete an old, segmented image with id 10. However, they also had an
image with id 100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001, and since
"10" is a prefix of "100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001",
swiftclient thought that the second image was just another segment of
image 10 and deleted it.

Further, had someone issued a GET request for /glance/10, the
resulting response would have contained the bytes from 10's segments
*plus* the bytes from 100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001,
which is definitely not the right behavior.

Obviously, this change doesn't go back and fix up old
manifests. However, it should help prevent this problem from
recurring.

Change-Id: I37577fde7751ad76ce543bc59eb7ee8de2187ac3
'}]
commit_message:
Use more-specific value for X-Object-Manifest header.

When uploading a large image to Swift, the segments are named
glance/<imageid>-<segmentnumber>. However, the value of
X-Object-Manifest is only glance/<imageid> without the trailing
dash. This can lead to odd behavior when there are other objects that
start with <imageid>, but are not actually segments of the image.

For example, in bug 1112653, a user was using python-swiftclient to
delete an old, segmented image with id 10. However, they also had an
image with id 100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001, and since
"10" is a prefix of "100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001",
swiftclient thought that the second image was just another segment of
image 10 and deleted it.

Further, had someone issued a GET request for /glance/10, the
resulting response would have contained the bytes from 10's segments
*plus* the bytes from 100b2316-9187-48d8-b327-dded22d1dc71-00001,
which is definitely not the right behavior.

Obviously, this change doesn't go back and fix up old
manifests. However, it should help prevent this problem from
recurring.

Change-Id: I37577fde7751ad76ce543bc59eb7ee8de2187ac3

commit_message:
update install_venv_common to handle bootstrapping

old install_venv_common used oslo-config, which makes for bad
recursive dependencies, and we can't build a venv from a fresh
tree.

Change-Id: I09336d760842d4eb57f2b70fdfe19afaf6520a48

commit_message:
Fixes Bug1130377  devstack ldap set values in keystone.conf

Addressed reviewers comments and added some extra properties
needed by latest version of keystone.
This fix sets some needed values in keystone.conf to ensure
that keystone can add entries to LDAP and remain schema
compliant.  It creates a new special role (_member_) that
is needed by the latest version of keystone and also
fixes tenant_id to be tenantId.

Change-Id: Ia2a1ebb7cbedb0af106c74aa9181843cc9739f5d

subject: VNC Token Validation
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-22 22:48:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I'm also interested in opinions on the rpc API changes from other reviewers.  

The issue here is that while the rpc API is versioned, we can't bump it like we normally would in a change against master, because the version numbers already have a meaning as the API has progressed in master.  So, the approach here is to just punt by not messing with the version number and just making sure changes are at least backwards compatible.

The downside isn't *that* bad, really.  If a newer client sends a message to an older service that hasn't received this update, it will fail just as it would have it if were versioned.  The exception that comes back will be something like a TypeError or AttributeError, depending on which method is called, instead of an rpc version error with a message explaining the API version mismatch.

In the past we have just avoided making rpc API changes in stable branches, just like db migrations.  In this case, it's a security issue so I think we need to.  I think this approach is acceptable, but would love to hear other ideas if anyone has any."}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:15:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Had to change the change id to match the id for grizzly. Change set moved here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22758/"}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-02-22 23:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

See this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22758/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 20:48:44.000000000', 'message': 'VNC Token Validation

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix a bug where the console for the
wrong instance can be connected to via the console
if the correct circumstances occur. This change also
makes a call to veriry vnc console tokens when a
user attempts to connect to a console. This ensures
the user is connecting to the correct console.

bug/1125378

Change-Id: Id3ca49fb7929e8db4771ad1227e0fcafcfefdad0
'}]
commit_message:
VNC Token Validation

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix a bug where the console for the
wrong instance can be connected to via the console
if the correct circumstances occur. This change also
makes a call to veriry vnc console tokens when a
user attempts to connect to a console. This ensures
the user is connecting to the correct console.

bug/1125378

Change-Id: Id3ca49fb7929e8db4771ad1227e0fcafcfefdad0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 22:54:10.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal API updated to catch NodeNotFound

In patch ab9f8667c63d901f37d1662c5204fb2938be44fe, several
baremetal/db/api methods' exceptions were changed from InstanceNotFound
to NodeNotFound. The API extension for baremetal was not updated to
catch these, and this was not caught by unit testing. This resulted in
unhandled exceptions within nova-api if any baremetal node lacked an
associated interface.

While fixing that but, a few other unit tests for the baremetal API
were added, and a missing exception was added to db/api bm_node_destroy.

Fixes bug 1131430.

Change-Id: I15f7624723754f9d7b217b609663a2d709acb056
"}, {'created': '2013-02-22 15:23:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix exception handling in baremetal API.

In patch ab9f8667c63d901f37d1662c5204fb2938be44fe, several
baremetal/db/api methods' exceptions were changed from InstanceNotFound
to NodeNotFound. The API extension for baremetal was not updated to
catch these, and this was not caught by unit testing. This resulted in
unhandled exceptions within nova-api if any baremetal node lacked an
associated interface.

While fixing that bug, a few other unit tests for the baremetal API
were added, and a missing exception was added to db/api bm_node_destroy.

Fixes bug 1131430.

Change-Id: I15f7624723754f9d7b217b609663a2d709acb056
"}]
commit_message:
Fix exception handling in baremetal API.

In patch ab9f8667c63d901f37d1662c5204fb2938be44fe, several
baremetal/db/api methods' exceptions were changed from InstanceNotFound
to NodeNotFound. The API extension for baremetal was not updated to
catch these, and this was not caught by unit testing. This resulted in
unhandled exceptions within nova-api if any baremetal node lacked an
associated interface.

While fixing that bug, a few other unit tests for the baremetal API
were added, and a missing exception was added to db/api bm_node_destroy.

Fixes bug 1131430.

Change-Id: I15f7624723754f9d7b217b609663a2d709acb056

commit_message:
update identity to handle new table attributes

create_tenant JSON client currently passes 'enabled' as a string.
'enabled' should be passed in as bool.

new table attributes returns 'description' and 'enabled' values in the
body of response instead of in 'extras'. update test_tenants to check
the new location

Fixes: bug #1129621
Change-Id: I5e76e68f4088212dd5ebb7eb339e5a453e2f402b

[{'created': '2013-02-22 00:39:10.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup of identity/admin/test_users.py

Cleanup of test_users.py, partially to help debug 1103081 where
test_delete_user sometimes fails. This is not a fix for the bug,
but the extra assertion will help narrow down where the problem
is if it occurs in the future

* Add status code assertions to more thoroughly narrow down where
  errors occur

* Replace startswith type status code assertions to check for the
  actual expected status codes on success rather than just 2*

Change-Id: I57e560c6ce85743c09380fa93d7c752ecf087b75
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup of identity/admin/test_users.py

Cleanup of test_users.py, partially to help debug 1103081 where
test_delete_user sometimes fails. This is not a fix for the bug,
but the extra assertion will help narrow down where the problem
is if it occurs in the future

* Add status code assertions to more thoroughly narrow down where
  errors occur

* Replace startswith type status code assertions to check for the
  actual expected status codes on success rather than just 2*

Change-Id: I57e560c6ce85743c09380fa93d7c752ecf087b75

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 21:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed reddwarf connection url (db_url) to get set correctly.

Devstack commit afc29fe5f210a8e78bafaafe7e8b3b5de733971c (Deprecate
DATABASE_TYPE and use_database) broke us such that the reddwarf
connection url was not being set correctly.

The Database type is now selected by adding it to ENABLED_SERVICES like
any other service. This fix makes sure that the ENABLED_SERVICES are set
before lib/database is sourced.

Fixes bug: 1131935

Change-Id: I7a122676e9fdf569fde3d3e57b81925d41e48b20
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed reddwarf connection url (db_url) to get set correctly.

Devstack commit afc29fe5f210a8e78bafaafe7e8b3b5de733971c (Deprecate
DATABASE_TYPE and use_database) broke us such that the reddwarf
connection url was not being set correctly.

The Database type is now selected by adding it to ENABLED_SERVICES like
any other service. This fix makes sure that the ENABLED_SERVICES are set
before lib/database is sourced.

Fixes bug: 1131935

Change-Id: I7a122676e9fdf569fde3d3e57b81925d41e48b20

commit_message:
add sysstat to enabled services list

no in devstack, this will give us an idea of system load when
critical things fail in the gate so we can track down some of the
intermitent fails, and hopefully reduce the number of recheck bugs.

[{'created': '2013-02-22 17:39:35.000000000', 'message': "Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

sql and kvs backends
sql upgrade scripts
unit tests for backends, auth and v3 api
imodifications to the trust controller for creating tokens
Authenticates only user can be trustor in create
Deleting a trust invalidates all tokens created from that trust
Adds the trust id and the id of the trustee to the header of the token
policy rules for trust

Change-Id: I5745f4d9a4180b59671a143a55ed87019e98ec76

impersonate

Change-Id: I0a26c555f16d1856b23e2fe47d33a1e7ebfc448a
"}]
commit_message:
Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

sql and kvs backends
sql upgrade scripts
unit tests for backends, auth and v3 api
imodifications to the trust controller for creating tokens
Authenticates only user can be trustor in create
Deleting a trust invalidates all tokens created from that trust
Adds the trust id and the id of the trustee to the header of the token
policy rules for trust

Change-Id: I5745f4d9a4180b59671a143a55ed87019e98ec76

impersonate

Change-Id: I0a26c555f16d1856b23e2fe47d33a1e7ebfc448a

commit_message:
Wrap auth req & resp w/ container (bug 1131840)

- Auth requests are now wrapped in an `auth` container
- The `authentication` attribute in authenticaiton requests is renamed
  to `identity`, as this attribute is reserved for containing objects
  for identifying the API user
- Auth responses are now wrapped in a `token` container
- Auth errors may now include an `identity` object instead of having
  an `authentication` sibling

Change-Id: I0b0a71fc6185e95961d173a96b49efca24a87636

Migration 146: Execute delete call.

The original code constructed but did not execute the call to delete the
availability zone metadata records.

The fix is to call `execute`.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 23:23:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add `post_downgrade` hook for migration tests.

This can be used by tests to assert the state of the database after a
`downgrade` has been run.

This patch also renames `_prerun_#` to `_pre_upgrade` to match.

Change-Id: Id2a100a8270835d1ef6f9908ff5b89e2b531bb3c
'}]
commit_message:
Add `post_downgrade` hook for migration tests.

This can be used by tests to assert the state of the database after a
`downgrade` has been run.

This patch also renames `_prerun_#` to `_pre_upgrade` to match.

Change-Id: Id2a100a8270835d1ef6f9908ff5b89e2b531bb3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 23:15:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix migration snake-walk.

The original code was not actually running `downgrade` because it
attempt to `downgrade` to the current version.

The fix is to downgrade to the current_version - 1.

Change-Id: I69484039269a17e343404bff195a6f84af56972c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix migration snake-walk.

The original code was not actually running `downgrade` because it
attempt to `downgrade` to the current version.

The fix is to downgrade to the current_version - 1.

Change-Id: I69484039269a17e343404bff195a6f84af56972c

subject: Unify assertions on expected exceptions.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 97, 'name': 'Daryl Walleck', 'email': 'daryl.walleck@rackspace.com', 'username': 'dwalleck'}, {'_account_id': 1794, 'name': 'Donald Ngo', 'email': 'donald.ngo@hp.com', 'username': 'donald-ngo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4325, 'name': 'Jaroslav Henner', 'email': 'jhenner@redhat.com', 'username': 'jhenner'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6683, 'name': 'Pavel Sedlák', 'email': 'psedlak@redhat.com', 'username': 'psedlak'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-19 19:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Let the exceptions propagate, with the original stack trace.

The exceptions derivate from TestCase.failureException, will show the test case as FAIL the others are error.

We must avoid using the self.fail as much as possible."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-19 19:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

self.assertRaises is the prefers way, the text is not important IMO.'}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-19 19:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Below are the two stack traces. 

with this patch:

_StringException: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/donald/source/tempest/tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_servers_negative_donald.py", line 52, in test_create_with_nonexistent_security_group
self.fail('Server was created with security group that does not exist')
AssertionError: Server was created with security group that does not exist

and using assertRaises:

_StringException: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/donald/source/tempest/tempest/tests/compute/servers/test_servers_negative_donald.py", line 45, in test_create_with_nonexistent_security_group
'fail',self.image_ref,self.flavor_ref,security_groups=security_groups)
MismatchError: <bound method type.create_server_with_extras of <class 'tempest.tests.compute.servers.test_servers_negative_donald.ServersNegativeTest'>> returned ({'status': '202', 'content-length': '442', 'x-compute-request-id': 'req-e003276b-1ef8-483c-b7f2-af1e5192303e', 'location': 'http://15.185.112.29:8774/v2/51a64ec9ac434af9b987177c3d8e41b3/servers/630dabf2-6969-4ef5-b6ef-1ae168f134a6', 'date': 'Mon, 11 Feb 2013 22:02:21 GMT', 'content-type': 'application/json'}, {u'links': [{u'href': u'http://15.185.112.29:8774/v2/51a64ec9ac434af9b987177c3d8e41b3/servers/630dabf2-6969-4ef5-b6ef-1ae168f134a6', u'rel': u'self'}, {u'href': u'http://15.185.112.29:8774/51a64ec9ac434af9b987177c3d8e41b3/servers/630dabf2-6969-4ef5-b6ef-1ae168f134a6', u'rel': u'bookmark'}], u'OS-DCF:diskConfig': u'MANUAL', u'id': u'630dabf2-6969-4ef5-b6ef-1ae168f134a6', u'security_groups': [{u'name': u'default'}], u'adminPass': u'6aYPUZj3cBvb'})


The error message is unclear to me what is going on.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-19 20:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

create_with_nonexistent_security_group is negative test, the message is trivially constructible, from these facts.

What is your plan, if in an operations series you expects multiple different exception?

How can you be sure if you have multiple statements in the with context the right one thrown the expected exception ?

If you have multiple statement in a with context, and at the end you just see self.fail, which part did the mistake ?

The second example contains the method name too.

If you really think the text is useful, we should implement assertRaisesText variant.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 20:49:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/2208 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/4158 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/3877 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/8638 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/455 : FAILURE (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-19 22:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-19 22:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My comments inline:

What is your plan, if in an operations series you expects multiple different exception?

Every statement where I expect an exception will have a one to one with ExpectedException around it.

How can you be sure if you have multiple statements in the with context the right one thrown the expected exception ?

I will always have a single statement where I am verifying an expected exception.

If you have multiple statement in a with context, and at the end you just see self.fail, which part did the mistake ?

Same thing as the above comments. There will be no use case that I can see where I will have multiple statements under the with context. Always would be this case:

with ExpectedException(exception I expect)
     1. statement where I expect the exception should occur
     2. self.fail("Clear message on why I am failing this test")

The second example contains the method name too.

If you really think the text is useful, we should implement assertRaisesText variant.

Added Jay and lifeless to the review. Lifeless suggested writing the assertions on expected exceptions this way. Any comments lifeless and/or Jay?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-19 22:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

self.assertRaises is the prefers way, the text is not important IMHO."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 23:51:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/2/check/gate-tempest-pep8/2211 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/4253 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/3972 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/8744 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/22341/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/457 : FAILURE (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-21 03:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

My 2c on this is that we should be using assertRaises and that the text in the assertion is not important. assertRaises is a very clean and short way of defining what is expected. I think that way of doing it works well in other areas of tempest.

It should be clear from the test what failure mode is being tested (if not a short comment is sufficient).'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-02-21 04:38:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Awhile back we had discussed writing a wrapper around assertRaises that allowed for a message, but that was several months ago. I'd be good with that solution, or using something like hamcrest matchers where the assertion itself spells out the intent i.e.(self.assertThat(lambda: 1/0, raises(ZeroDivisionError))) <-- borrowed liberally from the testtools docs"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-21 20:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-21 20:13:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1794, 'date': '2013-02-21 20:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-21 20:53:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Unify assertions on expected exceptions.

Create one process on the way we expect to assert on exceptions, using "with ExpectedException" suggested by lifeless.

1) Add to HACKING the way we expect to assert on exceptions.

2) Have a few cleanup patches that fixes all the code.

We will start with: test_servers_negative.py

Fixes bug 1130302

Change-Id: Ib0d149d251bc153873f3ffdaacb0a369b9b52f7f

subject: Migration 144: Fix drop index statement
messages:
[{'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-21 23:40:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is there a new fail condition here if they previously dropped the index, so it just wasn't found at all? Much like adding indexes we want to make sure we don't fail if the dba did some adjustments to indexes on their own."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-02-21 23:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-22 00:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-22 00:05:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sean: I don't think there's a new fail condition, in both the old and new code we try to issue a DROP INDEX call no matter what, so if the DBA manually dropped it, in both cases it would fail."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 00:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 00:26:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ok, so not a new fail condition, but can we change this to just emit a LOG.warn when trying to drop an index that is gone, and move on gracefully? I'd rather not explode in an migration under any circumstance as it leaves us in a weird spot.

After that I'd be +2."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-22 02:44:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> ok, so not a new fail condition, but can we change this to just emit a LOG.warn when trying to drop an index that is gone, and move on gracefully? I'd rather not explode in an migration under any circumstance as it leaves us in a weird spot.

The idea of gracefully handling dropped indexes is probably a good idea, but if we're going to do that, I'd prefer we handle that with a different patch that fixes all migrations at once (for example looks like 136 would need tweaking as well)."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 12:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

ok, but you're on the hook for that patch. Don't make me come hunt you down. :)"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-02-22 16:42:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mike Bayer (author of SA) gave a helpful explanation of why drop index is behaving this way: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/sqlalchemy/as8aNff6A-o

TL;DR: SQLAlchemy-migrate wrongly treats the Metadata object as something which can be used to alter the database. It's really intended to be built-up (added to), and then emitted once.

TL;DR of the TL;DR: Switch to Alembic for H :-)"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-02-22 17:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 23:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'Migration 144: Fix drop index statement

When dropping an index related to a column, we need to make sure that
the `Index` object is removed the `Table` object, otherwise a subsequent
`drop_column` call to that same column will error out as it tries to
re-drop the index.

Change-Id: Ie6533b011ead1bc5dd2542041d50eb82e5654a55
'}]
commit_message:
Migration 144: Fix drop index statement

When dropping an index related to a column, we need to make sure that
the `Index` object is removed the `Table` object, otherwise a subsequent
`drop_column` call to that same column will error out as it tries to
re-drop the index.

Change-Id: Ie6533b011ead1bc5dd2542041d50eb82e5654a55

[{'created': '2013-02-01 04:40:27.000000000', 'message': "Check for non-default volume name template.

The iscsi delete methods in iscsi.py had hard-coded volume names
'volume-%s'.

If a user configured volume_name_template to
something other than default the result is failure to remove
the iscsi_target.

volume create worked appropriately and created the correct name
in the DB, so the persistence files were the only thing affected
or named incorrectly.

Fixes bug: 1101071

Change-Id: Id5575874b2cebd9b3509d739cb92abf06c503c4e
(cherry picked from commit f02c575b4b28b69cade6c1c06dd772c62754fc9c)
"}]
commit_message:
Check for non-default volume name template.

The iscsi delete methods in iscsi.py had hard-coded volume names
'volume-%s'.

If a user configured volume_name_template to
something other than default the result is failure to remove
the iscsi_target.

volume create worked appropriately and created the correct name
in the DB, so the persistence files were the only thing affected
or named incorrectly.

Fixes bug: 1101071

Change-Id: Id5575874b2cebd9b3509d739cb92abf06c503c4e
(cherry picked from commit f02c575b4b28b69cade6c1c06dd772c62754fc9c)

set dhcp_agent_manager for ovs plugin

as doing so broke DHCP for other plugins.

If swift is not enabled, there might be no point starting the backup service...

In a multi-node config, you currently need to run the backup deamon on each cinder-volume node'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-22 00:18:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Added cinder-backup service (not enabled by default)

cinder-backup service has been added to cinder. This fix adds the
cinder-backup service. To enable this service, c-bak must be added
to ENABLED_SERVICES in the users localrc. To actually perform a
backup the user must enable swift or another service.

Change-Id: If4ef8d78081be572987e7c38c76ff57e82b4f744

[{'created': '2013-02-22 17:40:51.000000000', 'message': 'Close file descriptors when executing sub-processes

Pass close_fds=True to subprocess.Popen(), as is currently done in
nova.utils.execute().

Note that this folsom-stable branch fix is not a cherry-pick of the
master branch fix at https://review.openstack.org/22486 due to prior
refactoring in grizzly.

Fixes bug #1130735

Change-Id: Ia7a889b21a8069b559cb4641480abf416dfc903c
'}]
commit_message:
Close file descriptors when executing sub-processes

Pass close_fds=True to subprocess.Popen(), as is currently done in
nova.utils.execute().

Note that this folsom-stable branch fix is not a cherry-pick of the
master branch fix at https://review.openstack.org/22486 due to prior
refactoring in grizzly.

Fixes bug #1130735

Change-Id: Ia7a889b21a8069b559cb4641480abf416dfc903c

commit_message:
Update openstack.common

Updating to common from Feb 21nd that brings in the new
join_consumer_pool() method of the message bus connection class.
The new method should let us fix the Quantum bug 1047015 replacing
the declare_topic_consumer()

Change-Id: I9e5ad45d3d9c3fb11fec1b0c755bf60dacadf199

commit_message:
Doc bug fixes for Identity/keystone Grizzly updates.

fix bug 1071424 - PKI is now default for keystone
fix bug 1074191 - New config file fields for LDAP
fix bug 1103040 - With new config file fields, names like itsec go away
fix bug 1111773 - Re-emphasizes that you must have middleware for s3
fix bug 1130249 - Fixes user-update param confusion in Identity doc

Change-Id: Id21aa27944a0fb68ebfdf20e77fb94950ac141c3

commit_message:
Added --vlan=100 to nova-manage network create

This current folsom wants to have vlan_start set or will
cause a error:

2013-02-14 23:08:32 18626 TRACE nova KeyError: 'vlan_start'

patch2 addresses comments by Alvaro Lopez, adding a link to the bug
 and removes the exception from the commit message.

Change-Id: Ic8d45c2cbbcae3b7ca635a1794e857211a4f0ccc

commit_message:
heat loadbalancer : make LB nested template create credentials

Create User/AccessKey resources correctly in the LB nested template
so we can create a cfn-credentials file which will allow cfn-hup
to access the CFN API

fixes bug 1131663

Change-Id: I11b6640dbc5689de8f6103f4c1e841f42acbba54

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-21 19:45:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix launching libvirt instances with swap

The code in

  commit 7be531fe9462f2b07d4a1abf6687f649d1dfbb89
  Author: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
  Date:   Tue Jan 15 20:43:48 2013 +0000

    Refactor code for setting up libvirt disk mappings

accidentally broken launching of instances where
the flavor had non-zero swap specified. This was
not caught due to complete lack of test coverage
for the '_create_image' method. This adds two
test cases for that method, exercising this bug.
It also fixes a bug in netutils which was not
handling a NULL network mapping, which is a valid
scenario for several callers.

Fixes bug #1131306
Change-Id: I214561ba3ec6440d11a5afb0665e6b6f990bd148
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix launching libvirt instances with swap

The code in

  commit 7be531fe9462f2b07d4a1abf6687f649d1dfbb89
  Author: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
  Date:   Tue Jan 15 20:43:48 2013 +0000

    Refactor code for setting up libvirt disk mappings

accidentally broken launching of instances where
the flavor had non-zero swap specified. This was
not caught due to complete lack of test coverage
for the '_create_image' method. This adds two
test cases for that method, exercising this bug.
It also fixes a bug in netutils which was not
handling a NULL network mapping, which is a valid
scenario for several callers.

Fixes bug #1131306
Change-Id: I214561ba3ec6440d11a5afb0665e6b6f990bd148
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

to glance

commit_message:
Deprecate DATABASE_TYPE and use_database

Select a database by adding it to ENABLED_SERVICE like the other
services.  This greatly simplifies using the lib/* functions in
places other than stack.sh

Backward-compatibility is maintained or now (into havana at least).

Change-Id: I967e44603b4d69d5d70e1a75a9938172ca434025

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-20 17:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'replace use of cirros 0.3.0 with 0.3.1

cirros 0.3.1 images have several significant improvements over 0.3.0, including:
 * newer kernel (3.2.0-25.40)
 * support for more filesystems (vfat, iso9660)
 * support for configdrive (config-drive-v2) as a datasource
 * acpi reboot/shutdown
 * curl with https support (previously there was no way to get https urls)

Change-Id: Idd7bef0cebb941f77d1cead9dc990fa0b03ff46b
'}]
commit_message:
replace use of cirros 0.3.0 with 0.3.1

cirros 0.3.1 images have several significant improvements over 0.3.0, including:
 * newer kernel (3.2.0-25.40)
 * support for more filesystems (vfat, iso9660)
 * support for configdrive (config-drive-v2) as a datasource
 * acpi reboot/shutdown
 * curl with https support (previously there was no way to get https urls)

Change-Id: Idd7bef0cebb941f77d1cead9dc990fa0b03ff46b

I'm not very comfortable with this new base test class. If we really need to inherit from three classes just to make a new base class, I feel like we need to re-evaluate our architecture."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-21 02:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

It seems like this is more an issue with testtools, testresources. I think we had a particular set of needs that were met by these libraries but only by inheriting from three classes. Maybe testtools should provide a single class we can inherit from the way we used to with unittest2.TestCase or something. I do agree with the idea that there should be a unified base class for Tempest. If you have ideas of how to make it better that would be great.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-22 06:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

We already essentially have this multiple inheritance just at a higher level. So this patch is not making things any worse, in fact quite a bit better as its much lower maintenance.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 11:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

commit_message:
Have all test case to use a single base class

* All test cases are able to share on the same config
* All test cases are permitted to use the testresources
	(after we have suitable TestSuite in Tempest)
* On resources name collusion the "resources" variable renamed to
  "os_resources"

Change-Id: I7acf2fac26eefe801a87bcbe4b1caacc762c59b9
